Reviews.Title: “Great Location Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Godott
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located on the up-scale museum strip and around the corner from one of the major night life districts of Montreal (although Most of Montreal could be classified as a "night life district"). It sits across the street from McGill's front gates and at the foot of Mount Royal. It is, in other words, ideally located -- very close to all the action for both the day and night. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The beds were extremely comfortable. The sheets had a higher thread-count than mine at home. We were provided with robes, hair-dryer and iron, etc.. The view out our 26 storey window was spectacular. The front desk was very welcoming and everyone from the concierge to the doorman greeted us warmly each time we entered or left the hotel and everyone seemed eager to please -- and interested in helping us to enjoy our stay. I would definitely stay here again. Top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: MikeNYC123
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean and nice describes everything in this hotel - room, pool, gym, lobby and the people who work there. We got a very good price by booking through Priceline. It is bland in the usual corporate way, and is not close to the trendy, hipper parts of town that have the most interesting bars and restaurants. But it was very serviceable and an easy cab ride or a pleasant walk (I went in the summer, so I can't speak to colder months) to anywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Roarmaag
Reviews.Content: Good location on Sherbrooke West/Peel Street with the access to Mount Royal hill and recreational area. Spacious rooms. Good service. Free WiFi when you in advance register as a "preferred guest".

Reviews.Title: “A word of warning about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Liz155004
Reviews.Content: Construction noise in our room on the 6th floor was deafening when my husband and I arrived on Friday afternoon for our anniversary getaway! My husband requested a room change and we were given a room on the 21st floor. No noise there. Thanks, Alexandra, for making the change for us.The hotel is only half full due to the renovations, which are extensive, not just the rooms, but structural changes as well. Beds were extremely comfortable, and on the 21st floor we had a great view of the Montreal skyline. There's a charge per day of $11 for wireless internet - surprise surpise. Valet parking was $28 per day and not very prompt. Breakfast in the LL level restaurant was terrible and overpriced for the quality. Since we had a discounted rate, the hotel was so-so OK, but I wouldn't pay full price. Wait till the renovations are done!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1Waddy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Omni several times in the past. The hotel is under renovation but you won't even notice. The staff is excellent, the concierge always willing to help and satisfy every need. There was some confusion at check-in but this won't be an on-going issue as I did bring it to the managements attention and they've taken care of it. The hotels downtown location is excellent, you can walk to almost anywhere. I'll be staying again in December and looking forward to seeing and staying in one of the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: Frederic G
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at this hotel via Expedia's last minute deal concept where you actually don't know what hotel you will get until you proceed with payment, but you do get to choose what type of hotel you want: how many stars, downtown location, etc. I opted for a 4-star hotel downtown and was pleasantly surprised when my confirmation came up with the Hotel Omni, at a price of only 131$, all taxes included, for one night! The hotel is presently undergoing some important (and needed) renovations, so it will be interesting to see and stay there after work is done, which is slated for end of 2012: new lobby & bar, bigger restaurant, revamping rooms and hallways. For now, its biggest feature is certainly its location, in the heart of Montreal's downtown core, nearby the Centre Mont-Royal where there are lots of conferences, including the one I was attending. Staff was very friendly, in particular during check-in and check-out. Breakfast was OK, with a choice of either hot or continental buffet, but nothing to write home about. (And too expensive, as is usually the case in most hotels, at around $20 for buffet breakfast) NOTE: When you check-in, register for the loyalty program and get free wifi during your stay. Well worth it, and you can always unsubscribe to the program after your stay... ;-)

Reviews.Title: “a nice little gem in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Guywilltravel
Reviews.Content: The staff was outstanding - concierge, reception, bell hop ...everyone was very courteous and helpful. We were originally shown to rooms across from the elevator on the 9th floor. Not a good spot at all and on the small side. The bell hop could see this was not going to work and asked us to take a seat and he would see what he could do. Less than 10 minutes later we were escorted to 2 rooms on the 8th floor at the end of the hall (812 & 815) - absolutely gorgeous - spaceous, clean & quiet. Went from being very apprehensive to absolutely thrilled. There is construction on site but it was never an issue or a concern. Would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “No star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UnforgettableRome
Reviews.Content: I booked myself into the Omni Mont-Royal in Montreal for the weekend. NO where at the time of my online booking with OMNI did they indicate to me that the hotel was under renovation. This property is the former Four Seasons Hotel in Montreal, the property was taken over by OMNI about 25 years ago, the decor is still the old decor of the Four Seasons and it is now dirty and tired. The carpets in my room and other public area are frayed and dirty, fabric on furniture is greasy and stained, towels have seen better days, the furniture is used and now looks abused. There are no restaurants in the hotel due to renovations, only a side bar can serve drinks, coffee etc... So you have to go out to eat. Room service is available put $12.50 for coffee and a bun is a bit much. As for the renovation it is not clear what they are actually doing or when it will be completed. This looks very much like a property OMNI forgot, I did notice one block east on Sherbrooke street the new Hilton Garden Inn, maybe next time I will check it out. Forget the OMNI it is not worth your time or money.

Reviews.Title: “so relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Janymontreal
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a great hotel. I sometimes go there even if I live in Montreal just to relax, enjoy the amenities and mostly just to enjoy the city view, specially on a winter stormy night. There are windows floor to ceiling and wall to wall in the rooms, so thay all offer a great view of the city. The rooms are very comfortable, and at this moment they are renovating the hotel which is quite sad because the rooms have old and beautiful dressers and chairs and beautiful wallpaper, and it is a shame it will probably all disappear. I don't find it outdated but charming. There is a pretty nice gym and a greal little jaccuzzi. Staff are great and on my last visit they sent me strawberry covered chocolate since it was my birthday.. Nice touch. Everyone should become select members as you get free internet and a pot of coffee delivered to your door in the morning. Great place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some reservations”
Reviews.Author: MissMartya
Reviews.Content: This was an ok hotel. Nothing over the top. It def needs to be renovated! They still have tube tv's in cabinet hutches, which is unacceptable now-a-days. I got what I thought was a deal on priceline, but not really considering that it is an older modeled/designed hotel. What I will praise is the concierge service! Those guys go out of their way to help and a very friendly! I think at first they are likely to suggest the more touristy places downtown, but once we expressed our interest in off the beaten path, they tailored their suggestions. The location is pretty good, close by metro and an obstructed view of mount royale. This was my 3rd (for pleasure) trip to Montreal and as I learn more about the city/neighborhoods I would compare this location to that of Midtown in NYC--meaning: convenient but you aren't really going to get the authentic expereince. Bottom line, there are much nicer hotels in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: N.M.J.O.
Reviews.Content: The Omni gave us a beautiful view of the cross atop Mount Royale, in a spacious room at a very reasonable price. It was right on Sherbrooke near the Museum of Fine Arts and Holt Renfrew, and the included breakfast was fantastic. No complaints at all about this hotel. Joining the Omni group was worth it for the free Internet, free papers and free morning beverage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Smirshner
Reviews.Content: I booked a 5 night stay on business for ~$120/night expecting a small room with very basic amenities. To my pleasant surprise, my room and bathroom were huge. The decor was extremely outdated, however I was more concerned (and pleased) with the amount of space I was given - a king sized bed, 2 desks, one couch and a large bathroom. I was given the impression from the front desk that Internet was included, however when I checked out, there was a charge on my bill. I simply had to join the "Select Guest" membership program (free) and they reversed the charges. During my next stay, since I was now a Select Guest, I was offered fresh coffee/tea/juice delivered to my room in the morning at any time. I was also pleasantly surprised at the Gym facility. It was unlike most "hotel gyms" which tend to be tiny and extremely basic. Hotel Omni Mont-Royal has a beautiful facility. I had a great experience overall and continue to book my future stays here. Apparently the 10th night stay is free!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service won us over”
Reviews.Author: Bergie01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned an overnight getaway to Montreal by train from Ottawa to celebrate my birthday a few weeks ago. For convenience to the train station, we often stay at the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth, but Omni had a fantastic promotional rate of $99 a night so we decided to check it out. If the sidewalks had not been so icy, it would have been an easy walk to the hotel. As it was, a short cab ride did the job for about $8. The location of the Omni is excellent, bordering McGill University, right on the edge of Mont-Royal, and right in the middle of excellent shopping and restaurants. The room wasn't overly impressive, but it was very clean, big enough for what we needed, and had a very large bathroom with lots of marble. The TV was old (and not flat-screen), which seemed unusual for a high-end hotel, but no big deal. As it turned out, my husband came down with a virus while we were there, so we spent a lot more time in the room than we planned. We ordered room service for dinner and breakfast. The food was fine, not extraordinary, but it came promptly and was served with care. I booked a last-minute massage at the Amerispa downstairs. The massage was excellent, but the facility looked pretty tired. It could use some updating for sure. I also used the hotel hot tub on our final morning there. The health club that is beside it looks very good, with plentiful equipment. But the hot tub, change rooms and especially the "steam room" were not very appealing. I think there is a renovation coming up, and it definitely needs one. I didn't try the sauna because it was down the hall near the men's change room. I looked in and it was quite small and filled with some chatting men, so I took a pass. So while some aspects of the hotel could definitely be improved on, we would stay there again with no hesitation. I am a stickler for good service and the hotel aced this aspect! Everyone we encountered, from the front desk to the concierge, to the room service waiters, to the doormen, to the health club attendant, was extremely friendly and helpful. We felt welcome and relaxed and that makes all the difference. If you're staying here, make sure to sign up in advance for the Omni guest program. It gives you free WiFi, newspaper, a large bottle of water delivered to you after you check in, and "morning beverages" delivered free each morning. We ordered orange juice and it was brought on a tray with two apples. Finally, you should know that less than a block away is a great breakfast/lunch/coffee spot called Vasco de Gama. We thoroughly enjoyed the food and espresso and the staff were very friendly. On the morning we left, I walked to Au Pain Dore, a bakery also a little more than a block from the hotel, and picked up fantastic sandwiches for the trip home. I also bought a box of pastries...eclairs and lemon and chocolate tarts. They were insanely good! All in all, if you can get this hotel for a decent rate, it is more than worth it! We hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “What a great weekend I had!”
Reviews.Author: szinesz
Reviews.Content: I loved my end of January 2012 weekend at the Onmi Hotel in Montreal! The staff is wonderful, the room is elegant, super clean and very wonderful, the bathroom is spacious and great with fabulous towels and cosmetics. The hotel is situated in the middle of the best shopping on Peel, Maisoneuve and St. Catherines streets in the most wonderful selections of boutiques and malls and cafes and restaurants. It is across from the McGill university campus and below the mountain. Very central! if you just have an overnight suitcase, you can take the express bus for 8 dollars ( the taxi cost $40) to and from the airport, just walk 10 minutes in a straight line. Must try the buffet breakfast--the staff there and at the desk and in the Spa are first rate. I am critical, but I could find no fault. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Old, run down, shabby. NOT a 4-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DPCVT
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again. It was an old, run down mess. They say they are undergoing a renovation, which is great, but in the meantime the place is a disaster. Furniture, carpets, bathrooms etc. were worn out. Mini bar was empty and non-functional. Nightstand door was falling off hinges. Glass was missing from top of one nightstand and top very scratched up. Drapes and carpet were old, and stained. Phone system was out of order. Windows were single pane allowing lots of street noise in. Due to my experience at this hotel on this trip, even after the renovation I do not plan to return. They never should have let this hotel deteriorate to the point it has and should have simply closed the hotel during renovations rather than take guests money. This was NOT a 4-star hotel and having it included in the Priceline listing really degrades the reputation of Priceline as a booking site. My experience at this hotel makes me very hesitant to book through Priceline again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Chezzer27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice this past fall on business and each time I was very satisfied with my experience. Upon checking in, I discovered I had been booked into a smoking room. The bellhop was most helpful, calling down to change my room. Considering the hotel was nearly fully booked, I really appreciated it. My executive assistant booked my room, so I am not sure whether non-smoking is an option. If it is, definitely pick it if you are a non-smoker as the smell in my first room was unbearable. Check in and out was very smooth. I asked for dining advice from the concierge and was directed to a lovely restaurant just round the corner. The hotel does feel a little dated, but I feel like the helpful staff make up for it. The price of the rooms seem appropriate for the location. I would have no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Checked in on New Years Eve, Horrible Experience !!!”
Reviews.Author: inro41
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel chain ever again. I checked in on New Years back from Cancun. I booked a king suite suite through priceline for $160 for one night. I got a suite with literally one TWIN bed and a roll in cot. I was upset so called the front desk to change rooms. They were completely apathetic and told me I was lucky to get any room for the price I paid. I couldnt believe such arrogance. He kept saying that average room cost was 300. I told him I didnt care about cost. It was new years and I wanted the suite I had booked. He told me the hotel reserved the right to alter room assignments. I have never met such hostile or careless staff that make it there point to insult guests especially on a holiday. The bed itself had stains at its base and there was a 22" lcd tv in the room. What a horrible experience. Shameful and plain UNETHICAL !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value all around.”
Reviews.Author: JacksBack05101
Reviews.Content: Great Beds, sheets, climate control. Around the corner from Metro stop,and underground shops entrance. Maid swiped my USB wallplug, while we were out, (maybe she thought we checked out?) Management brought me a new one 5 minutes later, very pleased. Great food choices within blocks. it's very clean and classic.

Reviews.Title: “Great pick!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyPoo
Reviews.Content: Location within walking distance to almost everywhere we wanted to go. Rooms with a view ( ask for top rooms). The staff and concierge team were amazing. They helped us with everything. All were professional...clean and bright hotel. Its a must.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value if a Tad Dated”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: This property was one of the original Four Seasons way back in the day. The room layout of the Executive Suite is identical to the Vancouver and Toronto properties. Certainly it needs an update but the services is attentive and the value is certainly there. I would not hesitate to recommend it as a 4 star option in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: destinationbride2010
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Hotel Omni. The room was very large, and the bathroom was huge. There was a lot of room for workspace - a dining table area, desk, and seating area with a comfortable couch. The bath products provided were more than sufficient, which I have found to be very rare in any hotel at any level as I am very particular about my haircare products. Housekeeping was very helpful, and would visit twice per day. I spent a lot of time in the room working, and they were very careful not to disturb me, and instead would call the room to ask if I needed anything. The in-room coffee was pretty good, and could make two strong mugs. Room service was also very polite and helpful, and the food was good. The parking attendants were very kind and helpful, and quite efficient at retrieving our vehicle. The hotel location is perfect, as it faces the south side of McGill campus and is a very short walk to restaurants and shopping. The floors did not have too many rooms on them, and instead the hotel is very tall, so I found the hotel to be really quiet. We were on the 23rd floor, and had a great floor to ceiling view of the city. I will be staying here for any future trips to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amy P
Reviews.Content: Everything we experienced at this hotel was first-rate. We were apprehensive about the decor based on the comments re: 'Grandma's house,' but in actuality we found it lovely: sparkling clean, elegant yet comfortable with flowered chintz, a very spacious and comfortable room with a large dining table, sofa for two, mini-frig and coffee maker and floor to ceiling windows overlooking downtown with a view of the St. Lawrence in the distance. Service was excellent, and Danny the doorman saved us twice with his recommendations. Au Pain Dore down the street is a great place for cafe au lait, croissant, sandwiches and the best bread to take home. Great centrally-located downtown location. We will definitely make this our #1 place to stay next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: hugo003
Reviews.Content: Nice service, great breakfast buffet, quaint but confortable rooms great views on the city and a nice heated exterior pool.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home In Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Jacques_Alex
Reviews.Content: For many years we've chosen the Omni for its reasonable prices considering the excellent location on Sherbrooke Street, near museums, art galeries and Holt Renfrew as well as at short distance of Ste-Catherine Street shops. In the sixties it used to be a Four Seasons Hotel and still has some of its old world charm and is comfortable enough despite some of the rooms being dated. Staff is friendly, you have on site a good spa and if you choose to have breakfast, it is served buffet style and worth a try. For the little extra it costs, you should ask for a suite with king bed facing the North side of the hotel, you'll have a great view of Mont Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectation”
Reviews.Author: JFLND
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Omni Mont-Royal in late September 2011. Unsure what to expect as it was first time in a long time that I stayed in a hotel different from the 4.5 stars one I usually stay at when I am in Montreal, but no regrets. I left pleasantly surprised. The room was very spacious and well coordinated with nice furniture and a long list of amenities. Hotel's location is very convenient being close to the metro and some of the best shopping and restaurants that Montreal has to offer. Staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, an excellent quality/price ratio

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ECB2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni over the Canada Day weekend and at the height of the Montreal Jazz Festival. The first thing to say is that the hotel is in a great location. The major night-life and shopping centers of the city are all on the doorstep. The second strength is that the rooms are large, comfortable and clean. I will look for a room at the Omni for any future visits to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly, attentive service - wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSusieQ7
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful, friendly, and also give great recommendations for things to do. I did stay there once in winter and when my room was a little chilly they brought me a space heater. Problem solved! Try out the full service gym with windows looking at the city... bring a bathing suit for the pool (summer only) or the whirlpool. Join the Loyalty program, after a few stays you get free morning beverages...delivered hot and cold to your door. Room service is excellent, breakfast in particular. Try the bagel - it's a Montreal bagel..famous for taste! As a loyalty member you also get free wifi once you have stayed a few nights to qualify. Truly a friendly, elegant, hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip made so Pleasureable!”
Reviews.Author: DGB047
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the OMNI Mont Royal when I am in Montreal on business, which is fairly often. This hotel is truly a great find....close to shopping, university, business...all for a great price and amazing service! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “1932 PLAY BILL”
Reviews.Author: LulubeanKnowlton
Reviews.Content: Th is is not a review, however, I have recently discovered an old playbill from 1932. In it is an ad for a rooftop golf course on the Mount Royal Hotel. Were you aware that this ever existed? If so, would you be interested in seeing this ad? I assure you it is authentic!

Reviews.Title: “Omni Mont Royal Very nice”
Reviews.Author: nicklx
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in great location. Got a good deal on priceline, friendly staff. Room was very nice - only negatives were tv was outdated, but not a huge deal. Housekeeping was a little different than I am used to - they would come in and change the towels but not make the beds. Im sure if I called the front desk they would have been happy to help. Nice little bar downstairs. I would definitely consider staying here again on my next visit to this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi112
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend of nov 25th at this great hotel. Had the best view from our room. No pool but had fantastic hot tub. Easy walk to all downtown shopping and nice stroll to the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: snoju
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights, part of which was a conference. The room was very good, spacious and comfortable, quiet. The hotel is tasteful and attractive, the staff attentive and friendly. The fitness centre is spacious and well-equipped. Room service was slow but adequate. But the comfort of the room and the friendliness of the staff made up for that one small flaw. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Always Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: 1Waddy
Reviews.Content: The Omni is an excellent place to rest and relax while you take in the sites and sounds of Montreal. I've stayed here mid-December for the past 4 years while attending our office Christmas party and also last March while in town for a Canadians hockey game. The Omni offers friendly service while taking care of your every want and need. Guest rooms are clean, well kept, spacious and the beds are amazingly comfortable. The hotel restaurant Le Petit Opus has a wonderful buffet breakfast (highly recommended). Their loyalty program is one of the best. I've already booked for December 2011 and March 2012, I look forward to seeing the renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Work getaway in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: chibosspop
Reviews.Content: Fantastic suite, large and quiet. Room service great and afternoon turn down service. enjoyed my stay thoroughly; in fact cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty exactly as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Hy
Reviews.Content: We came to Montreal to attend an event downtown over the weekend. We booked 3 rooms for six people and selected the Omni based on a combination of location/reviews/stars and cost. Essentially, the hotel was very clean and the staff was polite and helpful. The rooms were spacious given the cost, and though they were not very modern, there was decent upkeep and dust/dirt free. Certainly they did not have that "old hotel" smell to them... they clearly work hard at maintaining their stars. Do not expect much of a view... in most directions you see another building. This in no way impacted me. I needed my room for sleeping only. At the door, they provided decent options for parking and even advised us on a lower cost option given our plans. There were some issues with cable TV not working, but that seemed to have impacted a lot of guests, and the hotel was very apologetic. Overall, if the point of your trip is to see Montreal, and not live in your Hotel, I see the Omni as a really good choice. If you are looking for a hotel to make or break your trip, there are much better options.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTrvlGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Montreal for a quick weekend getaway, and we loved this hotel. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms were very clean. We had a gorgeous view of Mount Royal and the hotel was in walking distance of great shopping and subways. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and plan to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but very dated”
Reviews.Author: P G
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean and comfortable, and the staff are very very friendly. The gym is also good, and you get free wifi if you sign up for their "select guest" program (as well as a free beverage delivered to your room in the morning). But do not expect anything contemporary. The furniture in the room is clearly from the 70s, with large floral drapes, and crazy carpeting. They also still had a very small tube tv with spotty reception - we made the mistake of ordering a pay-per-view movie. It was $18 after tax and the picture on the small tv was not clear. But overall, still a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but in need of upgrades”
Reviews.Author: ian w
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights recently. benefits: Great location, reasonable price, free wifi when you sign up for "select guest" program, nice gym and hot tub. the best bed sheets i have ever had.... not sure what they are made of but very comfortable. We also had a noisy room beside us, called down and the issue was resolved promptly. Negatives: In our room the shower had a stopper that was all sticking apart and the carpets in the hallway and in the room looked very tattered and torn. Entrance looked a little outdated. lightbulbs in room were burnt out on arrival and not replaced. furniture looks old and scratched. overall i gave the hotel a very good but it was more of a 3.5 Interiors need updates and carpets need to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: smokeboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni a few weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised. We were meeting another couple from Vancouver and requested rooms close to each other. We were placed next door to each other on an upper floor. The hotel seemed busy, yet it was very quiet in the rooms. The rooms are looking a little dated, but were spotless and very comfortable. Coffee and tea were delivered to the room each morning included in the room price. Staff was great from the doorman, the front desk people and the cleaning people. WiFi was also included in the price of the room.All and all it was a great stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A happy surprise!”
Reviews.Author: AKAPirateQueen
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because they had an excellent weekend rate (booked directly through their website) that included morning coffee in the room, because it had a rooftop pool, and because it was so close to McGill. It exceeded our expectations in all regards. Rooms were large, beds comfortable, and service exceptional. We had a wonderful trip and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur”
Reviews.Author: topant1
Reviews.Content: Disappointing on so many fronts; Room: tired decor, empty minibar, slow room service, 10 year old TV. Concierge: one over-stretched concierge and a 20 minute queue when we arrived. Very helpful when we finally managed to speak with him. Gym: a veritable museum for old, worn out kit. Breakfast: an under-sized dining room for the size of the hotel, resulting in a long delay for a table. Welcoming doorman: there wasn't one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: MrAbruzzo
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel based on its reviews in TripAdvisor and price I was quoted on its website. Based on the current weakness of the US Dollar, I was happy to pay only C$136 a night for three nights. I am happy to say I was not disappointed. From the outside, the hotel does not look like a four star establishment. It has a funny entrance, which looks like you are driving into a garage. Once inside, though, I was quite pleased. Everyone from the staff at the front desk, to the concierge, to the maids was very polite and courteous. The room itself was spacious and I found the beds to be very comfortable. It is true that the rooms are in need of an update. The furniture is chipped, there a few stains on the carpet and the decor is a bit old fashioned. I do understand that the hotel will receive a makeover at the end of the year, which is probably why I was able to get a good rate. As for the location, you are in the middle of downtown right across from McGill University. There are plenty of restaurants around and the area seems quite safe, even at night. It's about a 20-30 minute walk to the old port, but because it is mostly downhill, it's not bad at all. I do recommend taking a taxi back though. Between the location, the staff and the spacious rooms I highly recommend the Omni Mont-Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: vatai76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Omni for two nights as we attended a wedding at the hotel. The hotel is nice, clean and the staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. Our room was very large, with a very comfortable king size bed and a large bathroom. The decor is a little dated, but everything else was perfect and made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Still worthwhile at the Omni Mont-Royal (Montreal)”
Reviews.Author: Onttravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit Montreal at least twice yearly to see family and friends. For the last number of years we have enjoyed staying at the Omni (see my prior reviews for comparison purposes). I have also earlier this year stayed at the Omni when some business took me to Montreal. Whether the purpose of the trip is business or pleasure, this hotel continues to deliver value. First, it must be noted that the rooms are in need of a re-fresh. The carpet, while clean, buckles in spots and the bathrooms, while large and with marble, need an updating. Yet everything is spotlessly clean, the hotel staff are great, delivering wonderful service, and the hotel food is also of top quality. Considering that Montreal is a city with wonderful restaurants, that a hotel kitchen meets that quality standard is very good indeed. The location of the Omni at Peel and Sherbrooke, right downtown across from McGill University, is also attractive. Everything is close at hand, including (as winter approaches) the entrance to the underground path system where one can escape the elements. The hotel front-desk staff are very friendly and helpful and will provide you with all information you need regarding your stay, be it for business or pleasure. The Omni "select-guest" program, to which anyone can join, provides complimentary morning coffee and juice delivered to the room, along with complimentary wi-fi access in the room. Not every hotel provides such complimentary wi-fi (but all should) so kudos to Omni for doing this. Rooms recently were updated with new flat-screen TV's, and we understand that a major renovation will soon begin, seeing three floors done at a time (so make sure your room is not too close to floors undergoing renovations if you will be in your room during day-time, presumably no banging or hammering will be ongoing at night). The renovations are certainly due, if not overdue but, even today the rooms are nice, well kept, and with a great hotel staff. If you can ignore dated carpets and fixtures (albeit clean), then you will enjoy the Omni whatever is your reason to visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for downtown”
Reviews.Author: kitkatneko
Reviews.Content: I usually go to the sheraton on renee leveque (spelling?) and find the service just standard. somehow I ended at the Omni when the sheraton got full. it was the best thing ever as since then I only go to the omni hotel. rooms are bigger (yet no full screen tv but who cares?!), very clean, better service too for lower price. Also the location is just right downtown, near everything you need there. if you are lucky you get a view on the Mont Royal too. I just love it!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Brain_bleed_md
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed by the unassuming quality of the Omni in Montreal that I'm writing this review before even checking out! The hotel is located on Peel Street at Sherbrooke, right at McGill University, at the foot of beautiful Mont Royal park, and a few blocks from shopping and the heart of Montreal (the old city and convention center are a bit further). I was struck by the excellent service right from the friendly doorman, the attentive reception staff (efficient but informative check-in) and timely cleaning of the room (right when I stepped out for an hour). Joining the Select member club got me free WiFi. The room was surprisingly spacious and well-appointed. Beautiful view over the city. Bath robes, heated bathroom, turn down service, all things I would expect from a much more expensive hotel. All in all I would highly recommend the Omni for budget-minded travelers who still want 4-star luxury in the heart of Montral.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - but choose room carefully, can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: xenonian
Reviews.Content: We came to Montreal for business. We stayed 2 nights and had a reasonable experience. The hotel is well located as others have noted. Staff were all very helpful and professional, check in was quick and effortless. Hotel is looking its age around the edges, however very clean and well kept. WARNINGS: We were on the 6th floor - VERY NOISY ! You can hear all the street noise and the hotel soundproofing interior not up to par either - could hear hall conversations clearly. They should have told us upon check in the room was right across from the elevator, I am a light sleeper and might have requested something else - but we were tired from hours of driving and did not want to drag ourselves downstairs again for 2 nites. Suggest the front desk staff let guests know about room issues as a courtesy. Ask for upper level rooms to avoid alot of street noise during the week. ALSO - website said they had a pool - well they do, but is an OUTSIDE POOL - the fitness center person cheerfully told me it was "heated"...lol.....late September in Montreal. Fitness center adequately outfitted , I have seen better , but def have used worse. Only a block from entrance to Underground - so if you are looking for fast food - plenty to choose from for a snack or coffee. Final advice - make sure you know what type of room you are checking into if you do not like noise,

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Cargenty
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights with my daugther who came to study in McGill. The location is perfect, very close to good restaurants, transport, etc. We had a great view in the 31st floor. What I didn't love is the decoration, but the bed was very confortable and definitively the best of this hotel is the staff, specially in the valet parking area.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service!”
Reviews.Author: Reg-Jas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Mont-Royal for 4 days on business. The location is great for seeing a lot of the city. The hotel is a bit dated, but my room was huge, and very comfortable. The absolute best part of this hotel is the service. Tip: make sure you join the Omni's rewards program. At this propery, it entitles you to two clothing articles pressed free per day, a free pot of coffee delivered to your room each morning, and totally hassle-free check in. Conceirge desk is also very helpful. There was an issue with the water in my room the morning of my departure, and the staff went above and beyond to make sure I was taken care of - the manager even sent me an email after I left, to apologize for the situation, and offer me an upgrade during my next stay. Very classy hotel - I travel on business a lot, and rarely receive this level of service. Kudos, Omni Mont-Royal!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at Low Price”
Reviews.Author: bigisland_hangten
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel for a weekend and thought it was perfect. It was classy, luxurious, spacious and romantic. The staff and check-in process was quick and easy, just what you want for a short stay. The walk toward the main attractions is pretty short (unless you want to be spoiled at be at the heart of it all). We like the walk (3 minutes) because you get to see more. The subway station is close by so if you don't want to walk, that is also an option. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience luxury at a low price. I didn't check out many of the hotel amenities, but this hotel I believe has an outdoor pool which would be awesome in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Bev H
Reviews.Content: The Omni was in a fabulous central location and was a very nice, clean upscale hotel. The concierge was very helpful in familiarizing us with the city, especially pointing out some of the popular restaurants nearby that were not outrageously expensive. There are several great breakfast cafes/restaurants within a block or two from the hotel as well as hot spots for evening cocktails and mingling, so we opted to go out instead of eating/drinking within the hotel, although the hotel bar area was very nice. The shopping district was just a few blocks away, as well as the ticket office for the double decker bus tour, which we found to be quite enjoyable and an inexpensive way to get to other parts of the city. . We walked to the Museum of Fine Arts which was a few blocks away. The Omni provided excellent service and was a great place to stay in this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Un-impressed”
Reviews.Author: TravelBud24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends as we were visiting Montreal for a quiet weekend. Two of us were in our late 20's and our other friend was in her late 30's. Upon getting out of our car the bell hop was very rude and un-helpful. He held the door for all other guests and was willing to help them however, as this hotel caters to an older clientele he treated us differently. This was not a perception, we all encountered different incidents and found it down right discriminatory. We paid for breakfast with our room but upon checking in to our room, I reconfirmed and they hotel said they would not be offering breakfast with our room. We sought the assistance of the manager who said he was busy and would call our room within a few hours. No phone call came, we went to front desk and were sent back to our room to wait for his phone call again. I found the beds old, uncomfortable, outdated lobby and rooms, front lobby doors had cigarette butts all over, rude staff and management. I did find that other parts of the hotel were kept clean however, this hotel was rated as a 5 Star online and it should not hold that star level. I would not recommend this hotel anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling07086
Reviews.Content: I visited for a girls weekend and the hotel's location could not be better. Staff is friendly and most helpful. Rooms are huge! Its a great value for that part of town and you will not need to take taxis really anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel at super price.”
Reviews.Author: TerryinAylmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in February, 2011, treated like kings, great value for $120/night. Lots of extras, great location, staff very helpful. Walking distance to tons of shopping and restaurants. Rooms were spacious and quiet, well appointed. Minor problem with a water leak from the toilet tank which was fixed within 20 minutes of calling the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location getting renovated soon”
Reviews.Author: F1Q
Reviews.Content: Stayed off and on at this hotel over the last four years. Area is close to food and shopping. Was the Four Seasons hotel when built. Has large rooms with marble 4 piece bathrooms. A lot of common areas. Hotel is in need of some renovations - has a slightly anitque look to rooms but actually getting a little worn - staff indicates room renovations will start in winter of 2011. Good front desk service.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Omni Mont Royal!!!”
Reviews.Author: cutey_103
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just came back from a 4 day trip to montreal and we stayed at this hotel during our stay. I have no complaints about this hotel, check in was fast and efficient, the staff was very friendly and gave us a room with a nice view of the mountains!! The rooms are nice, a little outdated with the curtains and the carpet but that wasn't a big deal. The bed was very comfortable which is something you need after a long day of site seeing and walking! Bathroom was spacious and very clean as well! The hotel itself is nice, its got a gym, hot tub and rooftop pool on the 3rd floor. It also has a cafe but we didn't end up eating there during our stay. Every time we walked into the hotel you could smell the beautiful flowers in the lobby and the concierge desk was very helpful with giving us directions. Our last night there, there were some rowdy guys next door to our room and they were being very noisy at 2:30am so we called the front desk and they sent security up right away and actually moved them into a different room where they wouldn't disturb anybody!! The location of the hotel is also great, very close to all the shopping and restaurants/cafe's. Old Montreal is a half an hour walk or 10 minute taxi ride. We walked on the way there because it was nice to site see in downtown. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and will stay here again if I return to Montreal!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a tad dated but still stylish and clean”
Reviews.Author: Sniderette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Montreal for 4 days. We stayed at the Omni because of its location. We just wanted to park our car and be able to walk everywhere. While we were there we were able to walk to Old Montreal which was very cool. Old Montreal was like a little bit of Europe right here in Canada. Old buildings and churches that dated as far back as the 1500's! The streets are cobblestoned and closed off to vehicles which allowed for lots of street side patios and pubs, very european!!!! We also hiked up Mount Royal which was just down the street from our hotel. This hike, although was on a paved path and stairs most of the way was definitely not for someone not accustomed to strenous exercise. We did it at noon in July which is hot!!!! To say the least, it was an awesome view of Montreal and the harbour. A beautiful site!!!! Montreal is a beautiful city with lots of history, shopping, and amazing dining. Montrealers are friendly and will speak english even if you "try" to speak french to them. Definitley a trip I would like to take again, only this time I think I would head on to Quebec City too!

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Choice Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: PLS20011
Reviews.Content: From my friendly check in to my quick check out it was an excellent stay. Concierge services are superb. The very comfy bed compensated for the somewhat noisy location due to the Omni's downtown address. I especially enjoyed the (warm) pool and well-appointed fitness center, as well as the relaxing restaurant with limited, but tasty choices. The hotel is close to everything you need. My three quibbles (which should not deter anyone): First, in the (very spacious) bathroom, the water pressure was too soft and near yoga expert-level fitness was needed to reach the TP holder. Second, on customer service, there's free Internet access, but I had to hunt for that, which should not have been necessary. Finally, soon the hotel will need a facelift on decor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: QcAlber
Reviews.Content: Probably have already been a nice 5 stars hotel. Now it need major upgrades. Nice and spacious hotel anyway. Not very expensive. Nice spot.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, could do with an update within the next 3 years”
Reviews.Author: risteard
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Nice bar, great staff, lovely pool and close enough to Mont-Royal to make the hike.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: DianeMarie1963
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful. Went out of their way to meet our every need. The room huge and lovely. The view of city was spectacular. Right in the heart of all the action. We will definitely be going back to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Service made all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: NJMomx3
Reviews.Content: We recently drove up from NJ for a combination sightseeing and college-viewing trip. The hotel is in a terrific area, just across from McGill and within walking distance of many attractions. There's a metro stop around the corner, as well as entrances to the "underground city." Outside of Europe and Asia, I can't remember getting better service than we enjoyed at the Omni. We booked a family escape special for four nights through their website at $135 Canadian/night, which was a bargain! Room was very large, with a lovely view of downtown. Furniture a bit rubbed at the edges, but beds were comfortable, towels and bathrobes thick and comfy, shower pressure excellent (even on the 20th floor). Walls were also thicker than usual -- the hotel was full when we were there, yet we heard virtually no noise from other rooms. Concierge was incredibly helpful. We also LOVED the rooftop pool and hot tub, and the gym was well-equipped. One tip: sign up on their website to be a preferred guest (no charge for this, essentially you just join the mailing list). You'll get free beverages delivered to your room each morning (coffee in bed! Heaven!),free Internet, room upgrades if available, free clothes pressing (!) and special events -- there was a Martini-tasting in the lobby for preferred guests one evening while we were there. All in all, a terrific trip. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mkilburn9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch in all facets of hospitality. But first and foremost on all their minds is the guest. Will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad Overall, Great Location, Good Service, Rooms are Dated but Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: advisetrip
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - only a few minutes walk to most downtown entertainment, restaurants and shopping. The service from the hotel staff is very good. However, the rooms are very dated, worn and are in need of a renovation. The hotel lobby has a very elegant appearance however once upstairs it looks like a 1980's decor and some aspects of the room needed some maintenance. But the rate we got was quite good for a downtown hotel - so this was definitely a good value and overall worked out quite well. Pool and fitness center were good. Try to stay on a higher floor as there was some noise from the street at night (normal for downtown area),

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB Hotel ... I highly reccomend”
Reviews.Author: meliachia
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three, myself, my husband and our 8 year old daughter. We came up to Montreal from the states for a three night stay (and then moved onto Quebec City for three nights). I did a lot of research on hotels prior to picking the Omni, but kept coming back to it as we had stayed in an Omni in Philly and had a great experience. We are part of their premier club (forgot the actual name) and it comes with some nice extras. In addition, I LOVE the way they treat kids. We arrived around 12:30pm and were greeted with great panache by the bell men. Ready smiles and quick attention were so appreciated and we felt welcome. We quickly checked in but were informed our room was not quite ready. They did take all our luggage, store it for us, and present my daughter with her "arrival" backpack (yeah). We headed over to the Concierge who gave us some nice lunch choices and provided us with a map and some quick pointers. MUCH appreciated. The hotel is really well situated close to McGill university (make sure you walk around and visit their free science museum), shopping, tons of restaurants and the Metro. We came back a bit before 3pm and the room was ready. We were on the 18th floor and the room was lovely. It had a nice big King bed and a large sitting area with a little table and a wardrobe. The hotel is obviously older and carries with it the charm of a hotel from another era. That being said, it does not, in any way, feel in need of an upgrade. Our bellman helped unload everything and offered to get us ice. He gave us a quick tour of the room and then said adieu. We came and went quite a few times over the next few days and were ALWAYS greeted with smiles, open doors and even, once, when we were walking out, my daughter asked how we were getting to the museum and I said "by Taxi", by the time we had exited the hotel, the bell hop and run around through the door and had a taxi waiting ... so sweet. We also had great help from the concierge who gave us a discount to one museum and her card to get us speedy service at a restaurant (it was a HUGE help). One night, we had very loud neighbors that woke us around 1am. We waited a bit, but things just escalated, so we called down to the front desk. They were "ON IT" .. security was up within minutes and there was never another peep from the room next door. But, the most amazing thing was that by the next morning there was an email from the hotel manager apologizing for the incident (as if he had any reason to) and asking me to let him know if there was anything else I needed. What fabulous service. We also visited the pool and walked through the fitness area. It was all great. The pool had a neat little tunnel thing to get you from the hot tub out to the pool. It was nicely graded so my daughter could enjoy it and they had designated lap lanes so swimmers could do their thing, but kids could also splash around. I was THOROUGHLY impressed and will absolutely stay there again and recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Sverige2
Reviews.Content: Location next to McGill. The Redpath Museum (small lovely science museum, admission by contribution) is an easy walk. The Omni is child-friendly. What a nice touch-- with a "welcome" backpack and milk/cookies delivered to the room. Lots of restaurants, shopping and metro nearby. The rooms are beautiful; the health club is large and the pool is large enough for laps.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, I would go back!”
Reviews.Author: cpgem8
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a perfect hotel for a trip to Montreal, it is located on the main street (Sherbrooke) which is a easy location for walking to many sites. Lots of restaurants and bars are a very close by, no need for a cab, just good walking shoes. Old Montreal is about a 10 minute cab ride (or 30 minute walk) @ 10.00 CAD one way plus tip, or you can take the metro for about 3.00 CAD. Don't miss Notre Dame in old Montreal, a certain site to see. Rooms are decorated in a old world style, but very comfortable and very clean. I can certainly understand some reviewers complaints on the rooms however it is the style of the hotel and if you know going in you should not be leary. We had a total of 5 rooms all were different yet all clean and suited our needs perfectly. The beds were all very comfortable we all had good night sleeps. Rooms were cleaned in a timely manner and housekeeping always came by to check on things. The hotel will be going under a complete renovation soon, including all the rooms. The hotel staff was very attentive including the conceirge. We had a issue with a cab driver who dropped us off at a destination that was not where we were going, when we told the conceirge, she alerted the hotel manager and he reimbursed us for the cab ride on the spot, we did not even ask, he offered.. Great customer service. There is a pool/gym/spa, we did use the pool on a couple of occasions. It is a small pool and I do agree with a reviewer that the pool/lounge chairs are in desperate need of repair, but we were not there that long so we just dealt with it. They have food and drink service by the pool if need be. I highly recommend joining Omni Loyalty Program, you can join online @ Omni's website for free. There are some perks, and the best perk was a beverage/coffee for two each morning brought to your room at the time you specified (for free). When you check in you get a welcome packet, in the packet is the form to fill out for the beverage you want, time etc. It was there every morning without fail. I am glad I stayed a the Omni, and would certainly stay here again. Enjoy Montreal it is a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Renovations Required”
Reviews.Author: monarg
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and the staff are all without exception very pleasant, I had 4 warm encounters with staff before I even checked in. This hotel is priced well below other 4 star hotels for a reason, it needs serious renovations. The first room I checked into was old and had a poor view, I asked to be moved and the staff were very gracious and obliged. The T.V was an old Phillips pre-1980 model, the wooden furniture had serious chips and the drapes were in a word ancient, the pool chairs were threading apart and could give way at any moment.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant and willing to accomodate”
Reviews.Author: bl00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in December 2010 and it was a great stay. During our first night we had an "incident" in our room (at 1am) and upon reporting it to the front desk we were moved into another room. The next day the manager offered to pay for our stay but because we already paid via Expedia we instead were offered a comp stay. Other than that it was smooth sailing from there. I have stayed in many, many hotels in Montreal and the Omni is up there as one of the better ones. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: 8pixel
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay here in July and would stay again if we ever return to Montreal. We found our room to be clean and had a nice view of the city. Our only complaint about the room was that our fridge wasn't working very well but we fixed that by filling the ice bucket and storing that in the fridge. The concierge was very helpful and the staff was very friendly and spoke English without issue. The hotel is located right near the base of Mont Royal and not too far from St Catherine shopping areaâ€¦45 min to the top of Mont Royal and a 30 min walk to Notre Dame and Old Montreal. The gym is available 24hrs a day and is very large and has everything you need. Our biggest complaint was the fact that the pool closes early (7pm) and we didn't know that until we brought our daughter down around 7:30 to find it closed. We went to the pool the next day at 6:30 and returned to our room around 7 when we saw the lifeguard(?) return back to the pool and assumed that he was there to close the pool. Later that evening around 7:30 we looked down from our window and saw that the pool was still open (probably til 8) even though the posted hours listed closing time at 7pm on weekdays. One tip I can give is that internet/wi-fi is available for a fee in this hotel but if you join their rewards club (I forget the name but it is free and you just need to give an email address) you can have internet access for no chargeâ€¦thing is they don't really advertise this and you have to ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value”
Reviews.Author: rori1
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was at a significantly lower rate than similar 4-star hotels in the area. The service and location is great, close to shopping, restaurants and easy access to old town and other areas of interest by subway/bus (just a block away). Rooms are large with Mont Royal views, and free Wifi if you are a Select Guest member (sign-up for free). The concierge service is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Dov A
Reviews.Content: Once again, I received the greatest of service from the staff at the Omni Mount Royal in Montreal. Starting with the reservation clerk, Jean-Michelle, to the very welcoming doorman and the extremely accommodating front desk staff, I could not have felt more welcome. The location of the hotel is perfect there is a great pool and fitness center. The hotel needs a bit of updating and the pool should be open later during the summer hours. Other than that, I have no complaints and plan to stay there whenever I am in Montreal. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Extra charges for No Reason”
Reviews.Author: Wizzywarner
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just as described here. Nice views from the room, but the hotel itself is very outdated. I tried to use the phone because my cell was dead. I dialed out and it didn't work, the phone was either broken or the call didn't connect, I wasn't sure. Later I checked out and the man at the front desk told me that I had a long distance charge. I explained the situation and told him that their phones were garbage. He then apologized and said he had no problem taking it off my bill. But now I'm home in Halifax and I see the extra charges on my visa statement. Gotta love being lied to.! I will give them the great location and outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: OmnivoreNH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Mt Royal for a week in July. The location is great, the Metro is nearby, as are museums, shops and restaurants. The staff was incrediblly helpful and friendly. The veiws facing Mt Royal and the city are spectacular. The furnishings seem dated in style, but were in excellent codition and they are planning a major renovation. Parking is not on site and it would save you time to call ahead and get directions to the parking garage as the drive up reception area is small and choked with taxis. This is by far one of the nicest places to stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: esbwb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in July 2011. - location: close to shopping, close to restaurants, close to Mont Royal park, I can't think of a better location if you want to explore the downtown of the City - food: we only ate buffet breakfast but thought it was good. pancakes, waffels, bacon, sausages, eggs, smoked salmon, fresh fruit, bagettes, pastries, yogurt, juices, coffee/tea. It was more than adequate. - staff: everyone was super friendly and eager to please. - rooms: rooms are pretty big. larger than most standard hotel rooms for sure. furnishings were definitly older but I liked the style :) everything was in good condition and fully functional. I found the room very clean. the bed was super - soft white sheets and a duvet with a cover (I hate lying on comforters which I know are not washed that often). it felt very fresh and clean. The hotel has a pool on the 3rd floor rooftop which is nice for summer and a spa/gym which I did not use but it looked adequate. I would recommend signing up for the Omni rewards card online (free) it allows you to get some perks which are worth it - free wifi, free coffee/juice delivered to your room in the mornings, turn down service. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “Ive never been so disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: eowan
Reviews.Content: I recently tried the Priceline.com name your price for a hotel feature, i picked the highest standard available 4 star and went with the recommended 120 a night bid, not including tax. "Congratulations, your bid has been accepted at the Omni Mont-Royal". Now I have done my fair share of traveling and have stayed in about 20 or so 4 star hotels in the last year. THE OMNI MONT-ROYAL is by no means any where close to a 4 star hotel. The Room: -The rooms smell musty, and have an old cigar stench, and it wasn't just my room as they showed me 2 others and were all equally gross. -The furniture in the room is terribly outdated, and not in a classy way like you would find at the Waldorf, more like one of the first motel 6's. Every piece of furniture in the room was damaged, gouges, broken leg wobbly table ect. Service: The manager assured me that despite the obviously disappointing room that there service was unparalleled and we would be pleasantly surprised. - The service was far from excellent!! Our room was cleaned once out of the three days we were there, and even though they offered to clean it when we called in who wants to leave there room and hang out in the lobby for 30 minutes at 12am when you've been out all day. - We were stuck in an elevator, and adequate hotel compensation was 2 bottles of Perrier, we found that hilarious. - The only redeeming quality of this hotel is the outdoor pool, oops I forgot to mention that they close the pool whenever they feel like, despite the hours that you are told a check in. And lastly complaining is completely useless as they will not compensate you in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: 3RedDoxies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Omni. It is a great value and location. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Free wifi. Decor is more classic (not modern or edgy) but it did not feel dated. Hotel also has a gym and pool, though we did not use them. Location was close to the metro, and easy walking distance from shopping, dining and the tourist information center. It's right near McGill University. Easy to get around. You could even walk to Old Montreal in 20-30 minutes. Concierge desk was very helpful with maps, directions and recommendations, and even making bookings for us. Front desk was also efficient, and check-in was quick. Did not eat breakfast there - it is on the expensive side. There are several coffee/pastry shops within a few blocks of the hotel - cheap and cheery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, nice sized rooms and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: watwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days. The first night there was a disturbance at 3am, in the room next door. When I informed the front desk manager, he said he would do what it took to make us happy. We received complimentary breakfast tickets. The hotel is clean, well cared for, and the rooms are a nice big size. The breakfast buffet included cappucino, and there was a nice selection. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Pilgrim042
Reviews.Content: I am traveling with my husband and daughter. The room we had, had a king size bed and roll away cot for my daughter and we still had heaps of room to move around. The location was in easy walking distance to the information centre, shops, Mont Royal and Jazz festival. We did walk down to the old quarter several times though this 30 minute walk might not suit everyone. All the staff were friendly and helpful especially the lady at the concierge desk she was brilliant. My only problem was house service never filled up the tea bags, I had to keep asking and the fridge wasn't very cold. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Must for luxury & comfort, will be coming back again!”
Reviews.Author: KittenForever_06
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the smallest things count, being greeted by Pierre, having my bags taken in from the taxi & the welcoming staff at reception added to the experience, the room was huge & also did deliver a high speed internet access! room was cleaned to a higher standard than my own every day, breakfast was great & it's local to everything you could want, best way to get around is by metro by far, a place i would love to come back to again for business or pleasure, such a friendly & cultured city!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable”
Reviews.Author: ArchibaldTuttle_11
Reviews.Content: There's nothing exciting about the Omni Mont-Royal - it has no personality at all, and the decor is rather faded. But I always stay here, because: (a) Its location is great, being equidistant from all the most interesting parts of town (downtown, the plateau, the universities, etc.), (b) The rooms have fabulous views across the city (c) It just has a kind of sold, comfortable, cozy vibe. I don't quite understand how it achieves this, but I always feel relaxed and safe when I'm there DO NOT EAT BREAKFAST THERE. It's so expensive and so nasty. But that goes for all chain hotels. Go to the nice Portuguese restaurant down the street, they do a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy service even before check in”
Reviews.Author: Meme93
Reviews.Content: Came in on an early flight (6am) and was told we couldn't check in until at least 3pm. When I asked what they could do to accomodate us, was told that it depended on the hotel capacity that day. We would have to call when we arrived at 6am to see if there is anything available. If not, we would "have to have breakfast and go for a walk" for 9 hours! We were also told that should we check in at 6am we would have to pay for the night before. Ridiculous! They sell their hotel on hotwire and provide absolutely no options for early check ins. Really, really poor customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more...”
Reviews.Author: Gottago053
Reviews.Content: Everything was great- beds very comfortable/ marble baths- thick towels, concierge was fantastic- better service than any hotel I've ever visited! Hotel staff friendly and helpful- customer service A++++ Visited the Amerispa and massage was the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Crappy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhmills
Reviews.Content: The location is great but the hotel itself is old, tired, and needs a lot of work. It is not on par with other omni hotels and has definitely hurt my opinion of the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great city”
Reviews.Author: SagaLEB
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest at Omni in Montreal during a tourism trip in May 2011. I can say that this was a really nice experience which made my whole Montreal experience really enjoyable. Hotel in General It lavishly decorated at the lobby and really radiating. You feel that you are in a really top accommodation with all the bright colors. The check in sequence is very very fast and you get directly provided with your room key. the check out is even simpler as the bill is taken care of for you and slid it under your door. You of course get the chance to review it and inform front desk of any discrepancy. I really liked the loyalty program offered as for just being a simple member you get access to free high speed WiFi which for once is actually really high speed (thank you for living up to your promise) and free morning beverages delivered right to your door each morning. I had a room with breakfast, you should try the Opus breakfast, it is so simple and tasty, just what is need to kick start your day. What I really liked is that they don't just throw food at you but actually offer you with what you would be expecting regardless of what your expectations are. Staff Splendid and wonderful, always smiley always around you to provide you with whatever you need 24/7. Whether it is the really nice door men, the concierge, the front Desk staff, all are 5 stars and can't thank enough for a really nice service. Rooms They are very spacious with a desk area should you need to have some work done. Rooms might be a little old style but they are definitely very relaxing and very pleasant. they are equipped with all what you would need for your stay. The only remark I would have here is the safe box. While it is great to see a safe box embedded in the wall, it still feels safer to have a combination lock rather then a simple turn key. Location This is 5 stars, the hotel is located on Sherbrooke avenue in the heart of Montreal just a block away from the famous St. Catherines Street, Crescent, Villeneuve and other key landmarks in the city. Everything is 3 or 4 blocks away. Whether it is the metro station, the train station, great pubs, restaurants, bars... all are within reach in just minutes by foot. This hotel is highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel, excellent value. One issue.”
Reviews.Author: Reason88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni for a week long trip to Montreal recently. We booked through Hotwire (shudder) and found a fantastic rate to a program they don't run anymore saving us lots of money. I had never stayed at an Omni before, they remind me very much of a Hyatt. Our room was clean and comfortable, we enjoyed the view from the 25th floor. All staff from the front desk to the doorment were polite and courteous. The concierge, who has been mentioned on her before, is wondeful. Go to them with any recommendations you may need. They mentioned restaurants, things to do (bike tour, whitewater rafting) and we took them up on all of it and enjoyed it. Pool and hottub are nice and relaxing, great view from the pool. Spent time at the bar as well and had breakfast. Got wake up calls too, one mistake but mostly very pleasent. As for the decor, compared to the more edgy and modern hotels like the Opus I can see why people might think the Omni is dated. Still, we found the decor tasteful and nice. No issues at all. There is a spa downstairs for those so inclined. We had such a great expierience here that we woudl give it 5 stars. However, when we checked out and got our bill we found we were charged for valet parking each day of our stay. We hadn't even used their parking lot! This was a big mistake and would've cost us over $150 in false charges if we hadn't caught it. Once we brought it to their attention they were very apologetic and fixed it right away, but I do have to take a star away for it. Overall though, a great stay and an awesome value. Keep your eye out for deals and you will get a good bargain here. Also use everyone else's advice and sign up for the free swag deal with their rewards program.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Gail021
Reviews.Content: The Omni in Montreal is the best location for walking and taking the Metro. You can easily walk to the posh stores, museums and restaurants along and off Rue Sherbrooke, the shopping on Rue Ste Catherine and to the artsy designer places along Rue St. Denis. Within 25 minutes you can walk into Old Montreal. The Metro pass is $16.00 for three consecutive days and will take you just about anywhere in Montreal. There are multiple entrances to the Metro and the underground shops near the Omni. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms comfortable, roomy and well appointed. Staff are very friendly and the concierge is absolutely the best. She knows were everything is and is happy to give detailed instructions. This is our third stay and it feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Forget tour guides - ask the concierge instead.”
Reviews.Author: Calgarypro
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at the Omni - very nice hotel, very comfy beds, and even though the hotel is on Sherbrooke, noise was never a problem. All of the hotel staff that I dealt with were very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. I failed to get her name, but her recommendations for restaurants were fantastic. Italian / Thai - it didn't matter. She nailed both recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: bdgNy
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in early June. The hotel and the room were good - it was indeed worth signing up for the Omni Select guest programme beforehand, as it meant a free coffee or tea and orange juice and newspaper delivered to the room each day - be sure to mention it when you check in. I had an issue with a small but long window in the room next to the bed, which let light in, but after phoning the front desk, they immediately sent up someone to fix a black out shade as a solution. Altogether a very nice room, not dated at all, and excellent and friendly staff. I found the cost to use the internet in the hotel in the business center very expensive (although there is free wifi if you have your own computer, with the Select guest programme), but there was an internet cafe right across the street which has 10 minutes for $1. A great breakfast place with croissants, cafe au lait etc, is just down from the hotel, Au Pain Dore, 1415 Rue Peel - a 3 minute walk from the hotel, and much cheaper than the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional welcoming, but overall excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: CriticalButFair_8
Reviews.Content: As the title is leading to, the guy who welcomed us at the reception desk on arrival was rather unprofessional. When approaching the desk with my luggage, he looked at me as if I did not belong there and kind of shouted: "WHAT DO YOU WANT?" (it felt like shouting anyways...), to which I politely replied "Hello/Bonjour, I have a reservation". His attitude suddenly changed to more courteous and acceptable way to address a client. Once this initial unpleasant encounter passed, everything went smoothly. The room was ready, spacious and clean although the carpet was stained in a few places, and the furniture a bit tired. Prices were ridiculous at the Hotel's restaurant. Excellent location, great pool and patio, comfortable room, fresh flowers in the lobby, no hassle at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: balibeachboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for a week while attending a conference for work. After reading several reviews on here, I was expecting to check into a dated, frumpy hotel. That was not the case at all. The decor is conservative, but my room was tastefully designed, spacious, and clean. And the price was quite reasonable. it is conveniently located downtown, close to shopping, restaurants, and the train station. The area is expensive, though. I was not expecting to spend so much on meals. The Omni feels small, almost like a boutique hotel, but offers excellent service. Everyone I came into contact with in the hotel was pleasant and helpful. Another plus was the gym, which is large for a hotel. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but it looked nice. As other reviews have noted, it is a good idea to sign up for the rewards program in advance; members receive complimentary beverages delivered to their rooms each morning and free wi-fi. I will definitely return to Mont Royal the next time I stay in Montreal. I have no complaints--it was a great home base for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fine in general but some furnishings seriously need replacement”
Reviews.Author: AndreToronto
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a good location except for a few issues which detract from excellence. We arrived at 1700 on a Sunday and there was no-one at the front desk for a good 5 minutes. Had to ask the concierge to try and locate the desk clerk so we could check in. No problems with check in once he arrived, though. Rooms were very clean, no issues with the bed either, but the carpet was badly stained in front of the TV. And their single armchair and associated footstool had definitely seen better days, badly frayed and dirty. Other than that, we liked the hotel. Stayed there for two days. Other than the check in issue, the staff was courteous and helpful and knew where to find things in town which we asked about. We thought it was a little overpriced, and outrageous cost for Internet access which should certainly have been included in the room price, which was hardly cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, wonderful ambience.”
Reviews.Author: hrhsan
Reviews.Content: The biggest asset this hotel has, is it's staff.From reception to doorman, to cleaning crew to 2 wonderful and helpful concierges.As soon as you arrive you are welcomes by everyone and it's like coming home.The location of this hotel is wonderful, walking distance to old montreal, Mont royal park, china town, and all the fabulous downtown restaurants and underground shopping as well. Metro (peel station?) is 2 blocks away. Parking is self park or valet park, we used the self park and Metro as teh traffic can get pretty bad.
