Self park is $17 a day , and Valet is aprox $26 (i think or thereabouts) My room was on the 25th floor and the view of teh city was stunning especially at night.The rooms were quiet and well done ,.However, i did feel although very clean the furnishings looked a tad old and weary especially the carpet . I have two small kids who were delighted with the welcome little backpack full of games and candy.they also loved teh free apples at the lobby and all the attention they got from staff. Lobby is beautifully decorated with chandelliers and artworks. Free WIFI when you sign up for a free preffered guest on the hotes website.Great shopping on all streets near this hotel. Good fitness center/jacuzzi/pool

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Clean Room, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Alined57
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went April 30th for one night. The room was large and very clean. Although we are smokers, we did NOT smell anything, although I'm sure we were on a smoking floor (25th). We had a window that could be opened to release our own smoke. The view was excellent (Mont Royale), the front reception was very friendly, and the parking was great - 18.00 per night. All in all, we were very pleased, and will definitely return on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel though could use a good makeover. Great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Guynyny
Reviews.Content: Important: go to omni hotels website and get a free membership prior to your reservation, you will get a free orange juice, coffee and the newspaper every morning of your stay. The Omni in Montreal is great value, located in downtown close to the museum of fine arts and rue st. Catherine. Staff was super nice, roomservice food is good and relatively fast to arrive. Valet Parking is not cheap, about 27 CAD per 24 hours, but you can go in and out as many times as you need. The only downside is the old/ not updated rooms which although are in a good condition and very clean seem very irrelevant to modern times, I have not seen a regular CRT television (not flat) in years, I guess the Omni is where they go to die... Overall, great bargain if you find a deal (we got one throgh Expedia at about 410 CAD for three nights (mid week) taxes included. reg price per night is around 180.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Lucyinsky
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I managed to meet up from various parts of the country for a two night stay in Montreal. We got a great deal from one of the travel websites and had a great stay. The rooms seem a little dated, with that classic victorian feel although everything was very very clean and comfortable so nothing to complain about. The bathroom was large, as well as the room. Check-out was at Noon which was an added bonus for us as well. All in all, it's in a fantastic location downtown, just a few blocks away from the downtown action, and not far from other interesting parts of the city. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Made the trip to Canada extremely worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: Trejflorida
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before our trip and was silently expecting to be somewhat disappointed, but we could not have had a better time! The staff was ultra-friendly and helpful - there was even enough English spoken to make us feel understood and comfortable. Our room was on the 30th floor. We had a great view, the bed was large and sturdy, and the bathroom was well done. We had complementary juice, coffee and newspaper each morning. We dined all around the hotel and even walked the mountain! This was our one-year wedding anniversary and we have vowed to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfortable Hotel. Could use a remodel.”
Reviews.Author: Onvalaplage
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni during a trip to Montreal in 2003 and decided to make it my homebase on a recent weekend visit. The Omni is a nice hotel with a very good location. Everything is a quick walk, metro or taxi ride away. The rooms are large and the staff is very friendly. My only complaint is the decor is a bit dated. This I am sure was a top notch look in the 1980s but today it looks tired. Imagine Alexis Carrington walking about today in a shoulder-padded sequined dress with a frayed hem. But if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel that is comfortable and clean and situated in the heart of Montreal then this is a great option. p.s. Join the Omni rewards program before your trip and get access to free wifi and complimentary coffee and juice delivered to your room each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Traveller28Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and have to say that it is a very good hotel. Location is great, close to the shops and metro, and if you don't want breakfast in the hotel, there is a lovely cafe on Peel about a 5min walk away. Jim was also great, equipment works and there are a couple of tv's in there. Concierge very helpful and reception really good at their jobs. Also, you get free internet if you jon as a member of Omni hotels, so well worth joining when you book in as save quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous hotel in a gorgeous city”
Reviews.Author: jenk54653
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on Priceline for this room and were pleasantly surprised. it was roomy, airy, and very comfortable. Location was quite good, easy to get to public transportation which takes you anywhere.... No complaints at all about the hotel. Ate in the restaurant which had good food and wine...lots of great places nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel great location.”
Reviews.Author: BiscuitsGravy
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here in February for our annual Hockey vacation. We had a great time and enjoyed this hotel very much. It was very clean and the rooms well kept. The location is phenomenal, everything is close by and within walking distance. The price was a tad high, but what you'd expect from a downtown hotel. 140 a night plus taxes and valet charge. We did save some money by stealing the cot out of the stairwell instead of paying for it. Over all this was a great hotel and not much to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: roxie20
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Omni. The staff was excellent, from check in to check out. When we had a question all we had to do was call the front desk. The rooms were clean and quiet. All of our requests were taken care of, from an extra pillow to the morning beverage service. We will definitely return to this hotel, not only because of the service but for the price. P.S. before booking, join their rewards program, you gain points towards future stays, plus receive their morning beverage service and free high speed internet. There are also many Omni resorts in the US to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a 4 star hotel!!! BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: ottawatraveller86
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller I have stayed in many hotels, including hotels in different countries, but I have NEVER been as disappointed with a hotel as I was with the Omni Mont Royal. We booked this hotel expecting 4 star quality for a weekend getaway in Montreal, this hotel ruined our vacation. To start with, when we arrived we were told that our room was a smoking room as matter-of-factly as if we had requested it. Neither myself nor my partner are smokers so I asked that our room be changed to a non-smoking room. We were told that the hotel was "fully booked" (which I find very hard to believe on a random weekend in February), and that the room should not smell like smoke. We opened the door to our room to the stentch of smoke which filled the room. It was disgusting. The furniture and decor in the room were atrocious. I have never seen such old, worn-out, dirty and out-dated furnature in any hotel EVER. The carpets were stained, the chair was sagging, the curtains were awful and the vents were clogged with dust. In addition to this there was one window which did not have standard curtains but instead a slated wooden cover which let in a tonne of light both at night and in the morning. We could probably have survived given the above, but in addtion to the disgusting smoke smell, bright lights and bad furniture, we were also placed in a room right next to the elevators. It was VERY VERY loud, and I barely slept all night as a result. We woke up in the morning feeling stuffy and sick, probably a combination of the smoke and dust in the room. I can honestly say I am shocked at the good reviews on this site as well as the hotel's star rating. I am not the type to complain and this is actually the first time I felt obligated to write a negative review for a hotel but I feel that others out there should be warned! This is the first time that trip advsior reviews have let me down, the only thing good about this hotel was the location. Save your money and at any three star and I'm certain your experience will be better than ours was!!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good - **4.5 STARS**”
Reviews.Author: PEIsland-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I'm in Montreal occasionally for meeting and often choose the Omni as a place to stay. My most recent trip was just last week and my stay was no different than what I've come to expect. I was initially a bit concerned with being across from the elevator doors but noise wasn't an issue. I've never been disappointed with a stay. Being a Select Guest Member offers instant rewards, unlike many other programs. Free morning beverage service delivered to your room, morning paper at your door, local calls, free wifi, easy check-in (and early check-in if required), just to name a few. Most often a good rate can be found; regular prices a bit much although not out of keeping with the area. The gym is not your typical hotel fair, very spacious, lots of equipment and variety of workout machines plus some fitness class are offered. The gym does have members, not just for hotel guests, but allows for more offerings than usual. I haven't found it gets too crowded. Staff have always been pleasant and courteous. Rooms are spacious and beds comfortable. I would agree things are a bit dated but not dowdy. Everything is very clean, in good shape and has a certain elegance; it just needs a good freshening. I'm excited to hear renovations are planned, including new TV's. I hope they keep the mini-fridges in the rooms. I've been here in the past with family and my spouse was impressed with the roominess and cleanliness. The morning hot chocolate was a big hit (one of the many choices of free beverages for Select Guest members. Each guest is able the choose two beverages each morning of the stay). We've recommended to friends who enjoyed their stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location and price.”
Reviews.Author: madx80h
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. Just a few blocks from the Bell Centre. You're surrounded by restaurants and hotels within walking distance. Any by within walking distance, I mean literally 30 seconds away. There is a Metro right by the hotel, and every single major Canadian bank is just under 1 block away. TD, RBC, CIBC, BMO, Scotia, HSBC, etc. Awesome. Now on to the room. Our first impression when we walked in was, "What have we gotten ourselves into?" The room we were in had some kind of a chemical detergent odor. Almost as if the carpets had just been cleaned, or someone had been in there spraying Lysol for about an hour. Besides the odor, and the out of date decor, the room was fairly clean. The beds were small, but appeared to be brand new. There was a phone right above the toilet, which, we thought was odd, but we have our own phones anyway so it's not like we had to use it. Upon turning on the fan, we were overwhelmed with the smell of cigarettes. And eventually, the room started to fill with smoke. After making a complaint to the front desk we were moved to another floor. Apparently, you can smoke in this hotel. And since smoke rises, being on the floor directly above where you can smoke is not the floor you want to be on. (#24). Our second room was much better, and had no chemical (or smoke!) odor. The decor was still out of date, and the beds were still small, but again they appeared to be brand new, and were actually really comfortable to sleep on. Both rooms included a fridge, a heat lamp in the bathroom, and plenty of space for a couple of people. In terms of service, staff were friendly and helpful. Our bath tub wouldn't drain, but repairs were made right away. Toiletries and towels were re-stocked daily which was really nice. Use 1/10 of a bottle of shampoo? You get another. Use 1 q-tip from the package? You get a new package. Small things that made the stay more enjoyable. It's not like I needed that extra shampoo, q-tips, soap, etc. But it was nice that it was re-stocked in case I did. In conclusion, the Omni is a comfortable, clean place to stay within walking distance of everything you need in downtown Montreal. Their affordable rates make it easy to ignore the out of date decor. Just don't stay on the 24th floor.

Reviews.Title: “A great location in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: WeeLuv2Travel2
Reviews.Content: Got a pretty good Priceline deal on the Omni and was a little concerned when I read some of the reviews but it was a 4* hotel so figured it would be fine. Staff were all very helpful at checkin and beyond, room was on a corner so had windows on 2 sides and it was quite spacious. I was a member of their Select Guest program so wifi was free and we received 2 complimentary beverages and newspaper delivered to our door in the a.m. Restaurant/Bar isn't huge but we had a nice dinner there one night during our stay. The rooms are furnished traditionally but they were very nice and very comfortable. There was a sofa and 2 chairs and a table, unlike many chains which only have 1 chair, so there was plenty space to work on the computer. The room also had a fridge which was a nice bonus. Parking in the Superier garage round corner was about $17 a day. Access to the underground tunnels/metro was a block away. Would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absoultely Fine - i wanted to give it a 3.5”
Reviews.Author: Twentiesgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a really really delicious breakfast and is really very clean. The gym is also (according to my husband) really rather good for a hotel. The decor is somewhat out of date, the rooms felt a little bit like I was staying at my grandma's house! But they did have all the housekeeping and amenities that we needed. Service wise the staff were pretty friendly, particualrly the waiters at breakfast, although we did have some problems with the concierge not always being there and other ppl attempting to do his job not very sucessfully. Pricewise - we got a discounted rate and so I'm pretty happy with what we got for our money. I'm not sure whether it would be worth the full price, but then again my only real complaint was lack of atmosphere and out of date decor...

Reviews.Title: “Dated but very nice”
Reviews.Author: vesperalley
Reviews.Content: Ok so this hotel is a little dated. The photos on the website even show that. But that being said its such a lovely place to stay. My room was huge, with a big bed, nice clean crisp white sheets and loads of good quality pillows. Huge double wardrobe and big bright window. The bathroom was a nice size and I could clearly make out on the shower that the hotel was previously a Four Seasons, which gave the place a bit of authenticity. I used the gym a couple of times and it was always quiet and again, they have lots of machines and weights etc. The location is really good for visiting Montreal. Other reviews have commented that they disliked the Venetian blind in the window at the side of the bed, but I always sleep with the curtains open so I quite liked this feature.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but with hiccups”
Reviews.Author: eikoleto
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Omni Mont-Royal this weekend. My expectations were high given the customer reviews, but my stay was somewhat challenging. Good: - service was excellent; staff were incredibly friendly and prompt when I had requests - room service was fast and the food was decent - the location is great - the hotel is downtown, so you get the tourist experience, but it's also a quick cab ride north to more authentic Montreal - the room was huge Needs improvement: - glasses in the room were dirty (not that I ever use hotel glasses, but still...) - the robes in the room were rough and itchy...I'd rather not have robes unless they're soft - right beside the bed was a window that didn't have a curtain, but a slatted wood blind. It let a lot of light in. - the TV was right beside the bed, but high up in a cabinet and hard to see even when sitting up - I wish it had a mini bar. I realize these may only be in certain rooms, but why not give me the option when I make my reservation? - free coffee in the lobby would have been a nice touch Huge headache: - no really; I ended up with a terrible migraine that ruined an entire day of my trip. I get them when I sleep in a room with the heat on, so obviously before I went to bed, I turned the heat off. Except: the controls for the heat were broken, which I didn't discover until I woke up the next morning with my head pounding. The radiator was blowing out hot air. While the hotel fixed it quickly, it still seemed to blow out hot air even when we turned the air conditioning on. I realize I'm a unique case, but I still think you should be able to control the temperature in your room. Overall I would recommend this hotel for the price, but with a warning attached.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value. We'd stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: msg82256
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Christmas Day, 2010. So naturally, the hotel was quite quiet. We checked in to two rooms, one for my wife and me, one for our two kids (22 & 24). The rooms were right on a corner on the 19th floor, connected by a door. The rooms were spacious, clean, and the beds were exceptional. Very cozy. Throughout our stay the staff was helpful and courteous. We basically toured, shopped, and ice skated in the nearby Mont Royal Park and down on the waterfront. This hotel is well-situated, close to shopping, across the street from McGill University, not too far from Old City, and just down the hill from the wonderful Mont Royal Park. The on-site health facility was clean and well-maintained with a reasonable amount of equipment, including sauna, hot tub and steam rooms. Nice touch. There is no on-site parking. Though the recommended underground parking lot is just around the corner about 200 yards from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location and terrific facilities”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler66
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights between Xmas and New Years at the Omni Montreal, my husband and 11 year old son going twice each year to Montreal and often (as we did this time) with friends (another family with an 8 and 11 year old). We had a wonderful time!! Having a spa right in the hotel is a huge advantage and we liked the fitness room and the hot tub (and it's not very easy to find a hot tub in a Montreal hotel). Also the manager, David Kanter, provides outstanding and rapid service. While reviews say that the rooms need updating, both our families thought this was one of the best Montreal hotels even with the present furniture: don't be discouraged by reviews that say the furniture is old because the whole hotel has an elegant feel. The suites are on high floors are especially nice: it is a good idea to ask for high floor rooms as we did. The included buffet breakfasts were also perfect: plenty of selection and nicely served. So, even though renovations are planned for late 2011, we still had absolutely no regrets about staying at the Omni right now. Last but hardly least, the location is ideal as other reviews have indicated. It is easy to get to good restaurants (try the Taj for Indian and a Chinese restaurant with Orchid in the name which is right on Rue Peel), great shopping on Rue Saint Catherine and two subway stops are within one or two blocks. Altogether a wonderful place for a Montreal vacation. We plan to come back, especially when the outdoor swimming pool opens in the summer. hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but the rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: lingua5
Reviews.Content: The Omni Mont-Royal in Montreal is a great hotel, the staff are exceptionally accommodating and friendly. The switched effortlessly between English and French, which is good for those of us who only speak cursory French. The concierge desk has information on just about everything and the location is excellent for exploring the city on foot. The hotel is located about 2 blocks from the nearest metro station - which is fairly easy to use. Also nearby is Rue St. Catherine which has a wide variety of shops and restaurants to suit almost every taste. I opted for a a suite on this stay and the room was large and well appointed, but there were a few minor complaints. The carpeting was well worn and the guest bath smelled of mildew and had a broken drain plug in the tub. I contacted the management about the items and they were responsive and indicated that they are in the process of a hotel wide renovation which is needed at this point. If service and staff friendliness are important criteria for you, then the Omni is definitely worth a look. I've also stayed at the Omni in Chicago, IL and the staff there was excellent as well. This seems to be a common theme. These folks really go out of their way to make you feel welcome. During my stay I decided to shop at a local outdoor market and dine in my room. The room service brought up a place setting - without charge for me to enjoy my lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: dianex99
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel about 3 times or so and our stay has always been great. Last time we were there, the concierge convinced me to sign up for their rewards program (free) and with it comes a free upgrade. In the past we had stayed in the standard "no view" rooms (view of the top of another building). But with the upgrade we moved to a standard room still, but a little bigger and with a view of the park. Perfect! I was very grateful for the nice view. Service was always prompt and professional.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: rwueste
Reviews.Content: Very accommodating, excellent concierge, recommend highly

Reviews.Title: “Yes do stay here. It's a bit frumpy though.”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: Room was huge. Bed very comfy. Service excellent. Location great. The room was a bit tired and dated. The bathroom, while clean, but had seen better days. Same with table and desk in room. The TV worked fine, but was old (not really such a big deal, but for the standard of fixtures these days, and the rate paid was a standard rate ....).

Reviews.Title: “Immensely enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ambercoast
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Omni with my family October 23-26, 2010. We were there for both, business and pleasure. We are a well-traveled family (Europe, North America, Caribbean, etc.) and have stayed anywhere from 2 to 5 star hotels. We all agreed that very seldom if ever have we encountered such high level of personalized customer service, attention to detail, and warm and friendly reception. Both the room and the bathroom were spacious, beautiful, very clean and well-equipped. And it was quiet at night - a huge bonus for me as I am a light sleeper. No endlessly long hallways to run around and bang the doors! We also enjoyed the fitness centre, hot tub and sauna (very nice and hot, thank God, no men/women segregation here, you can all go in as a family to enjoy it). Yes, the hotel is not brand new but it has this amazing understated "old school" elegance and charm about it. Would stay there again with great pleasure. P.S. The rates were great on Priceline for our dates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not a 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: halisue61
Reviews.Content: Weekend in Montreal with my daughter...shopping, food, and big city atmosphere! Omni was satisfactory but can't compare with other 4 star hotels in Montreal. Really dated, and missing the extras most 4 stars offer, like flat screen TV, minibar, fan in bathroom. Furniture in room well worn and stained, not comfortable to sit in. Windows barely close and noise from street seems like it's right in the room! Nice workout facilities and sauna, but whirlpool only open til 7 pm?? Joined the rewards club for extras like coffee delivered to room in morning at requested time, nice touch but coffee was cold. Also included free wireless, and no problems there. Decent weekend but accommodations were just too old and dated to warrant the 4 star rating and along with it the 4 star price. I'll look elsewhere next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Very Friendly and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: katocatoxford
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel and location could not have been better. 1 block away from the Metro and the underground shopping centre. 3 blocks away from Crescent Street where lots of good bars and restaurants can be found. Rooms are very large and comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Only issue was that the room was not being serviced until after 4.00pm, however if we had raised this at the time the hotel would have told the housekeeping staff to make sure this was done earlier in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: MBurdge
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this was voted as one of the best hotels in the world by T&L. Booked a room with 2 double beds, we were given a room with 2 twin beds. Front desk was unapologetic. Another member of our party had a similar issue. Rooms could use some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: thenewedition
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay we had at Omni Mont Royal. For the price and location, this hotel is simply unbeatable. Sure, it is in need of some updating, but along with that will come an increase in nightly rates. The Omni is located on Rue Sherbrooke, which is only a couple streets north of Ste. Catherine and a leisurely 30- minute walk from Old Montreal. Of course, you can always hop on the Metro, which is two blocks away on Peel Street. The metro system is incredibly efficient and easy to navigate, and it is especially useful when exploring the (slightly) more distant parts of the city (Botatincal Gardens, Olympic Parc, Plateu area, etc). There really isn't much else that needs to be said here, the location puts hundreds of restaurants, bars, shops and myriad other kinds of entertainment all within a short walking distance. Okay, so the price and location are unquestionably great, but what about the rest? Well, rest assured because the Omni Mont Royal passes with flying colors in all categories. Upon arrival we took advantage of the valet parking ($26.50/night, the norm for a major city), breezed through a simple check-in, exchanged some money at the front desk and found ourselves in our beautiful room on the 27th floor all within 10 minutes of arriving at the hotel. The room was incredibly clean and also very large. Some of the decor needs to be updated but all things considered it wasn't unattractive at all. Plus, the bathroom was massive and our bed was extremely comfortable. We tried out the pool, hot tub, and breakfast buffet and found each to be above expectations. The buffet, while both delicious and convenient, is quite expensive ($17.50, I believe) and I would suggest just walking around and finding a small cafe, There are plenty and we ate at some great ones on Rue Stanley. Overall, a great stay at a great hotel and we will most certainly book a room at the Omni next time we are in Montreal. P.S.: Like countless others have already said, do yourself a favor and sign-up to become an Omni Select Guest member on their website. It's free and WELL worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice well run hotel more suited for business than leisure.”
Reviews.Author: bangalicious
Reviews.Content: My room and the Omni was large and clean. The king bed was extremely comfortable with the wonderfully crisp linens and wealth of pillows. Turndown service would leave the next day's weather and a chocolate, which was a nice touch. We enjoyed a massage at the large and well-run spa on the basement level. There's also an indoor-outdoor pool which is nice in the busy downtown area. The design of the rooms and the hotel itself however, was a bit generic...The location was also only okay--it was a bit of a schlep from the lively street scene on Sainte-Catherine. I would recommend this hotel to a business traveler for its efficient design and service. Leisure travelers might prefer a space that is more tune-in to the local flavor and style.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Guilhermo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. In a perfect location. Near very nice restaurants and shops

Reviews.Title: “Great location, indoor pool, and rates!”
Reviews.Author: thekeone
Reviews.Content: Drove to Montreal for a 2 day trip and ended up staying for four nights. This hotel is centrally located and has an awesome indoor/outdoor pool that is heated in the winters. It made for great relaxation after walking around town all day long. The hotel is a little bit dated, but exudes old school luxury. There are a lot of options in that area, however, so I would advise looking around for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & facilities, great service and a good location â€“ you canâ€™t go wrong”
Reviews.Author: OttawaAli
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in July this year during the Comedy Festival and havenâ€™t got a bad word to say about my stay. I stayed in a deluxe room that looked out onto the swimming pool - the room was huge (as was the bathroom), with a sofa, desk with chair and a small table, and ample storage space. The TV had lots of channels, although the cabinet housing it was in a slightly strange position making it difficult to view completely whilst lying in bed (likely due to my room being a corner unit, so not a standard layout). The bed was very comfy, the room clean and everything worked fine. Service at check-in and check-out was fantastic, staff were very friendly and the ability to store luggage for free was very useful. The health club area was brilliant, the large outdoor pool was particularly good. Although some of the decor was a little dated, it was all in good condition and the hotel in general was very clean. The hotel is located about 5-10 minutes walk from the VIA rail train station and is also very close to Peel metro station (although navigating through the underground shopping pathways can be a bit confusing at first) so is very easy to get to. From the hotel itâ€™s easy to walk to the main shopping areas and entertainment districts within Montreal, with most other areas easy to get to either by the metro or by using the BIXI bikes (a stand is located about a block away from hotel). Bad points â€“ None. Good points â€“ For the price, the location is excellent, as are the rooms and the facilities, to have all this in a downtown location is brilliant. Whilst the roads around the hotel can get busy, the hotel is quiet and offers an excellent place to stay (especially if you can find a cheap deal on the internet). If youâ€™re looking for something near the main downtown part of Montreal you canâ€™t go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jim_from_sf
Reviews.Content: I'm usually a bit fussy about hotels, especially once they're over $150 a night, but this one exceeded my expectations. Amazing location, wonderful service, clean, bright, spacious rooms, and the very best fitness facility I've ever seen in any hotel at any price. I would definitely love to stay there again. It is mere steps to the Peel Metro station and in walking distance to the best of everything in Montreal. The view from the rooms was wonderful, especially to the north with the view of Mont Royal itself.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong here...”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: In twelve years of business travel I have never stayed in an Omni, so for this trip to Montreal, I was unsure what to expect. Simply put, I was not disappointed. From the moment I was greated by Bernard at the entrance (who took care of getting Valet parking for me), to the warm smile I got from the two women working the desk, my stay at the Hotel Omni was off to a great start. I was quickly checked in, and offered my choice of papers the following morning. When I got to the room I was blown away by its size an appearance. Very spaceous room, nicely apointed work area and big windows giving me a beautiful view of Montreal. One thing that I was SURE would be a disappointment was the Internet. Normally yuou pay some silly connection fee (which you do here, but it was only $9.95) and then you get pathetic speeds making anything more than email a joke. Not here...the wireless was very fast, and would even stream videos without a hitch. Then there was the bed...a nice king that I was looking forward to, but again, never having stayed at an Omni, I wasn't sure what to expect. Just like everything else, the bed did not disappoint, and I slept better than I had in many years in hotels. In the morning, I was greeted by a HUMAN (imagine that) with my wake-up call. Breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was nice, but there was one thing I'd change. They buffet line offered a nice selection of fruits, cheese, smoked salmon and the standard eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes and pancakes. The eggs...powdered, which, given how nice everything else was, seemed really out of place. But still, at least they tasted good. All told, I was very, very impressed with every facit of my stay at the Hotel Omni Mont-Royal. The people were everything a company would want in a staff...at every level (at least those which I encountered). The quality of the room, all I could ask for. The location...perfect. I would say that this may be the first hotel in a major city that I would recommend for business travelers, honeymooners, romantic getaways, families...everyone. Just a total first-rate experience all the way around. Thank you Hotel Omni. You made my first trip to Montreal a memorable one that I will carry with me for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as Omni in Boston - but much better than Chateau Versailles in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: FraserCarrie
Reviews.Content: At first the outside seemed cold and much less historic than the wonderful Omni Hotel in Boston but the fabulous room, cleanliness, PHENOMENAL service, and location all made up for the lack of exterior beauty and history. We loved our room, we heard no one, we had fantastic free morning drinks, a lovely welcome note and water from the manager, and while we prefer boutique hotels, this was definitely an exception and we will stay here again. Loved it and definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Charmless, but well-located with big rooms.”
Reviews.Author: david_andrews
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special. The rooms are truly enormous though, and the location (practically on McGill's campus) is excellent. There is a lot of nightlife around the hotel. The hotel seems to cater primarily to academics and business travelers on limited expense accounts.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! Saved our family!”
Reviews.Author: MDredline
Reviews.Content: We had originally planned on rooming elsewhere, but when those reservations fell through because the accommodations were so awful, then we decided to brave it out and find a hotel for the 2 nights we were in montreal. I popped in the Best Western, and the Omni to compare prices. The Omni hotel had the best price- and when we arrived in our suite, it was so much more than we expected! The staff were exceptional and catered to all our questions and requests. Their cots were sturdy double beds- and there was plenty of space for our pack and play for our baby. We were 2 adults and 2 children (ages 3 and 1) and booked a suite- that is really the way to go with the little kids. The location is perfect with McGill across the street, restaurants and shopping down Peel street, and 720 autoroute just down Peel. It took us 10 minutes driving to Old Montreal, and the rest of the time didn't need the car. I have stayed in half a dozen hotels in montreal (Novotel, marriot, Days Inn etc), but the when we return to montreal, I am not looking elsewhere- we are staying at the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: SUFAN4LIFE
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews of this hotel, I had my reservations about whether I should stay here or not. I got a really good rate that was hard to turn down considering the hotel is in an amazing location. What worried me most before we arrived was the various reviews about the outdated decor, ect. We arrived at the hotel and was immediatley greeted by the bellman when we pulled up. We agreed to valet our car which allows you to have in and out privillages. Its about $26.00 for 24 hours. This is a really good deal considering it is very hard to find parking anywhere, and why would you want to park in a garage elsewhere when it will be more and without in and out privilages. I read a few reviews about people complaining about paying for parking. YOU ARE IN A MAJOR CITY, YOU WILL ALWAYS PAY FOR PARKING. If you don't want to pay for parking, don't visit metropolitan cities. I recently went to NYC and it cost me $50 a day at the hotel WITHOUT in and out privillages. The $26 is a good deal. Anyway, the very friendly bellman took our luggage inside and we checked in. The front desk workers where also very courteous and welcomed us with a smile. We signed up for the free frequent customer program. This gets you free WI FI. We then proceeded to our room. Eventhough, the decor is not modern and a bit outdated, the room was very clean and cozy. I did read that they were going to have a major renovation of the hotel soon. To our surprise we had a wonderful cheese and fruit plate waiting for us. It was obviously a mistake made by room service, but it didn't stop me from eating that yummy cheese. However, about an hour after we had checked in, room service delivered us a nice bottle of aqua panna with a nice personalized card thanking us for signing up for the club membership. BTW, if you open the water thats available in the room, it will cost you $7. The standard room also had a small sofa and dining table, along with a desk. The hotel also has an indoor and outdoor pool, as well as a pretty well equipped fitness center. There is also a restaurant, louge and spa. However, we need used any of these facilities, so I cannot comment on them. The best thing about this place, is the location. We walked everywhere from this place. The weather was beautiful so walking 5-10 miles throughout the course of the day was great! You are only a few block to the major shopping district. Its about a 25 min walk to old town Montreal. You are also close to St Catherine which has many many bars and restaurants. In fact, there are hundreds of restaurants within a 20 min walk. Overall, for the money, you can't beat staying at this place. You are not traveling to stay in a room all day. If you are more concerned about the staus of staying i a nice room, then stay at the Ritz down the street and pay $500 a night. Or save that money and go shopping and eat at the amazing bistros that this city offers.

Reviews.Title: “Best balanced nice hotel in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: hohohoooy
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights on business (congress) in late Aug - early Sep. Not too gorgeous, not too businesslike, nice, cozy and reasonable hotel. Front and doormen were kind and friendly. I was satisfied to choose this hotel to stay Montreal for the first time. And I almost forget, the location is also very good, express check-out system is fantastically convenient.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CHOICE IN MONTREAL”
Reviews.Author: stemor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel this month. Not having visited Montreal before, I chose the Omni because the usual chains (Hilton, Intercontinental etc.) were fully booked (there was a big conference on in Montreal at the time) and this looked like a good alternative. We were very pleasantly surprised. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful (even to the extent that when we checked in, the receptionist advised us to join the Omni frequent traveller program, which was free and gave us unlimited access to high speed internet in our room without charge. The concierge was exteremely knowledgabel and helpful about what to do and where to go in Montreal. The room was extremely spacious (which is just as well as we were on a month long vacation in Canada and the USA and had loads of baggage!) and comfortable, the breakfasts were of a very high standard, the location was just fine and within walking distance of pretty much everything in Montreal. In short, I would definitely make this hotel my first choice on any future visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - just beware extortionate car park fee”
Reviews.Author: phil100652
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3-night stay at this hotel and it was much better than expected. It's a very smart hotel and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is great too - handy for the Mont-Royal viewpoint, Tourist Info Centre and local shops, bars and restaurants. If you get tired of walking or want to visit further afield such as the Biosphere you can buy a $7 24-hour pass for the metro and buses from the Tourist Centre. Our room was large, very comfortable and mostly well equipped though not totally soundproofed to outside noise. Some days replacement toiletries were not left but otherwise very clean and comfortable. If you sign up as Preferred Guest (just provide contact details for marketing), you get internet and morning drinks delivered to your room free of charge so a no-brainer there. The only downside was the cost of parking. When we arrived, the parking valet asked if we wanted to park ourselves or let him park. Like an idiot and after a long drive, I let him and gave him a tip. When we got the final bill, we'd been charged $25.95 per day for 'valet parking'. Maybe self parking is cheaper. I suspect we got a room upgrade so overall we were happy with our stay but felt a bit miffed at the final sting.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GWSD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni because of its location (right across from Mcgill) and because it had a good price. I didn't expect a lot from it, but I was very pleasantly surprised. Yes, it does show a little wear in places, but overall it was really nice at the price we paid. The room we had was a very nice size and was well decorated. The fitness center is huge and well equipped. The pool is also nice, though it is outdoor and therefore closes at 7:00. The service was very friendly - everyone we talked to was terrific. The location is fantastic not only for McGill but for the museum/art district on Sherbrooke and the night life on Crescent. Overall, a very good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a good location”
Reviews.Author: 19DC76
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through priceline and can't complain for the price we paid. Nice lobby, very friendly staff, the bar/restaurant is a depressing little room squeezed in and the rooms are dated but nice. The bed was comfortable, the bathrooms are nice but the rugs, chairs and decor are a little behind. If you're looking to spend most of your time in the old port this is not your place but if you're up for exploring the whole city then the location is perfect. I wouldn't want to stay here again but have no regrets about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: flores71
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The spa was great. The pool is an outdoor pool, but even in August, it's a bit breezy, so I didn't really enjoy it. The restaurant is fine for breakfast or lunch, but not dinner. Room service was fast. Overall, I was happy with my stay, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not honour our reservation; be wary of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveller101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go for a long weekend to Montreal with our young son, who is nearly three years old. We decided to stay at the OMNI Mont-Royal because of its proximity to Mont-Royal Parc and downtown. It is also considered one of the better hotels in the city. Before we left, our reservation was confirmed by staff at the hotel. The day of arrival, I called to confirm again, to let the hotel know we would be arriving in the evening. Again - no problem. So imagine our surprise when we arrived, weary from the drive from Toronto, to find we did not have a room. The hotel had overbooked. They offered us a "boutique room" - literally a fold-out double couch.. or we could spent the night at the Best Western across the street. As you might imagine, the three of us could not sleep on a fold-out couch... so we had no choice but to go to the inferior hotel where the OMNI had got us a room. Well without getting too into it - the room was horrible. A few examples: the bathroom reeked of smoke, on a non-smoking floor, and was in desperate need of renovation. I asked for a quiet room, and they put us on the third floor with our window facing a VERY noisy Sherbrooke Street. It was so noisy, I had to go downstairs at 12:30 AM to ask for earplugs. We got little sleep. While David Kanters at the OMNI offered his apologies and we didn't have to pay for the night we spent at the Best Western... that is cold comfort. We were in Montreal for only three days ... and one-third of our vacation was ruined. I was exhausted. We heard all kinds of excuses: "Expedia overbooked", "All the hotel rooms in Montreal were full; we had to send you there." First, it is not believable that ALL the hotel rooms in the city were booked. And even if they were, a good hotel would not treat their guests like this. Especially when small children are involved. Needless to say, I would never stay at this hotel again. There are enough other hotels in Montreal... why risk having the OMNI "overbook" and send you to an inferior place I would never have my family stay at. I think a good test of a hotel's quality is how they react when there is a difficult situation. On this - the OMNI failed horribly. Hence, the rating.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElectricMayhem
Reviews.Content: We had a suite on the 28th floor. Got a great deal by booking through the hotel about a month in advance. Fantastic view over the McGill campus and Mont Royal. Incredibly comfortable king bed. Large windows. Very classy furniture. Quiet. There was a restaurant/bar in the lobby that looked good, although we did not try it. No parking on site, but there is an inexpensive option just across the street ($16 per day). As for location, this is a great location if you are visiting McGill. Also within a 10 min walk of most of downtown, including a lot of fun bars and nightclubs in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Looking a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: cyntul2no
Reviews.Content: Our visit was at best, average. The lobby was nicely appointed but there was no one to help us with our luggage. The room and halls were in need of renovation. Everything was rundown and shabby. The location was fine but the restaurant was disappointing. The bar was not an inviting environment for just having a drink. One irritation that I experienced was that I called ahead and spoke to the concierge to get information about an event taking place during our visit. She told me she would have to check on it and get back to me. She never did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decent stay at the Omni - rooms could have better”
Reviews.Author: u2greek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni for a weekend stay in July. The hotel is situated in the golden mile area of Montreal. We've been to Montreal several times and its the first time we've stayed in the area, and liked it as it was quieter and a little away from other parts of the city. Upon arrival, we self-parked in a lot that was a block away and not connected to the hotel . The only other option to park at the hotel is through its valet service. So if you have alot of luggage, definitely valet. We were greeted very well by any hotel employee we came across from the hotel manager, check-in clerk, concierge, etc. Having to make last minute dinner plans on a Saturday night, the concierge came through quickly and with a great choice for us on a busy Saturday night. Our room was a little spacious, but nothing in it stuck out to us. The room decor seemed a little outdated. The bathroom was a decent size, but nothing out of the ordinary. Internet was $10 CAD. The pool and fitness area looked very nice although we didnt get an opportunity to take advantage of the pool due to the rain. The hotel is situated just 2 blocks (steep uphill blocks!) from Mont-Royal Park, which we never experienced before. The hotel actually had a card showing a 2-3 mile path/route to take in the park, which we took advantage of. It was a nice hike and gave us a good workout. Overall, the Omni was a decent hotel and offered good value for the price we paid for it ($155 + tax). Would recommend staying here, but I have stayed in better hotels in Montreal that were similarly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service of the 100 hotels I have stayed at recently.”
Reviews.Author: rtf0823
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this property during my visit from 7/22-7/25â€¦as a frequent traveler I was taken aback by the old world charm of the property and the friendly staffâ€¦ from the doorman, to the greeting inside the front doors, the maid staff, front desk staff, and management everything was perfect. The welcome bottle of water and thank you not from management was greatly appreciated as was the free Internet and morning beverage service, and delivered English language newspaperâ€¦My room 2904 offered sweeping views of Mount Royal and much of the McGill Campusâ€¦I will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience Again”
Reviews.Author: christyb5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed again at the Hotel Omni Mont-Royal and were so pleased with our choice! From reservations to check out, the experience could not have been more pleasant! The location was fabulous with a floor near the top looking out over lovely Sherbrooke Street and the McGill campus; the staff could not have been more accommodating; we had a huge room with a very large bath; the cleanliness of the hotel and the service during our entire stay were both outstanding! It was just a short walk to the jazz venues and to all of the places we have grown to love about Montreal. We would not think of going back to Montreal without also thinking of Hotel Omni Mont-Royal. A public thank you to all who made our stay again one to remember. cdbrooks washington, dc

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni over July 4th week-end. With AAA rates booked several months earlier, we had a four star hotel at a great rate - about $150 U.S. a night. The room was a king with a couch - possibly a sleeper. Tradiitional furnishings - not contemporary. Clean, nice size bathroom. Desk, minifridge, table, and a TV in the armoire. If you join the Omni frequent guest program you get free beverages in the morning and one or two items pressed for free. This hotel has a nice lobby, small bar, concierge service, health club with many features, and an outdoor rooftop pool on the third floor. The pool doesn't get a lot of sun, but it was a nice feature in a city hotel where many hotels don't have a pool. Some of the rooms (like ours) have a view of the Mont Royal area - a green park-like expanse. The hotel is located near many galleries, restaurants and McGill University. It is not too far a walk to less expensive shopping and tourist attractions. The metro is nearby and makes most locations easily accessible and a short ride away. Don't miss the public market and botanical gardens! If you don't plan on needing the car for in and out parking, you can park it yourself across the street (the doorman will explain how) at a better rate. A great hotel, a great location, a great price, and a great week-end. (Consider visiting for the huge jazz festival in July)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the area”
Reviews.Author: Born2B
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay for sightseeing and the Montreal jazz festival. This area is considered downtown but not in the middle of all the shopping and noise. After my friends and I spent a couple of evenings eating and drinking on Crescent Street it was an easy walk back to the hotel. Its also within walking distance of the museums. We got recommendations for dinner from the concierge and was not disappointed any evening. The Thai at Phayathai recommendation was the best! As for the hotel, clean rooms and quiet. The gym was ok as hotels go but I don't go on vacation to love the hotel gym so my expectations aren't that high. Front desk staff, bartenders (Hi Mike & Pierre), doormen were excellent and willing to help with any request.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Snout117
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great. The rooms are a little tired, but still nice. Speedy checkin and very nice front desk staff. We booked the hotel through Hotwire and ended up only paying $105/night taxes in, so this was a great deal for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “It's like a shiny apple at the market but when you look at the other side it's bruised.”
Reviews.Author: Superman4267
Reviews.Content: So we were welcomed nicely by the guy out front. I give him an a+++. the service desk was an b+. Location is great!! It's an equal walking distance to peel metro and all the attractions. The rugs in our room were probally 20+ years old. I wouldn't have them in my house. I'd rip them out and bring it to the dump. The furniture is old but functional. The curtains were this pink floral that you find at grandma's. At least it matched the fabric of the bed and the mini couch and chair. For room quality I give it a d+. housekeeping was super!!! Resteraunt was so expensive so eat at a place called ruebens deli on st cathrine. It's great! Bring dessert back to your room before bed. The pool is divided in 3 sections. So god forbid you enter and someones doing a lap. We waited politely for the hottub but it never was open for us to go in. I saw ten diffrent people in it at once. Gross! Slimey!! We stayed outside and saw like 30+ people relaxing in a baterica thriving environment . I give the whole pool set up a f----.

Reviews.Title: “Wow great service, would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: hihellohi5
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed by the service at this hotel. They could not do enough and there was always a ready hello and welcome as we came and went. The employees in all areas of the hotel were excellent, there was not one that did not try to go the extra mile. The entry of the hotel is quite nice and the scent of the lilies was a great touch. The room we had was quite large and we had a great view of the city. The hotel is pretty central and it was easy to get around to shopping and nice restaurants. The only thing I would say is the carpet in the room and a chair or two might need a bit of an upgrade. Having said this though I would not hesitate in the least to go back again to the Omni, they did such an excellent job.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with the Omni!!!”
Reviews.Author: LYC
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with the Omni brand a few times already, so we figured it should be pretty reliable in terms of overall quality... And we were right! The bed was so comfy, the room so clean, and the service/attitude friendly and excellent. It was up to your usual Omni standard. I was not sure before booking, because there were a couple reviews here saying the hotel is dated - there were bits and pieces that showed its age, but it was so minor my husband didn't even notice (I only did because I kept those reviews in mind). I decided to book it because there was a good deal on its website (stay 3 night/pay for 2). The location was awesome!!!! It was close (very walkable) to Rue Peel, St. Catherine, St. Laurent, - where there were lots of shopping and restaurants. We only used the Metro once when going to Jean Talon market. The Rue Peel station is on the same block if need. We also just walked to the Gare Central (train travel) and Terminal Center-Ville (bus travel) - no more than 10 min. with our luggage. Old Montreal/Port is walkable, too - maybe 15 min. "Au Pain Dore" was a block away and we got our daily fix of baguette/croissant there (went well with the daily complimentary drinks at Omni!) We would definitely stay there again if we return to Montreal!!! BTW - the new Bus 747 that runs to/from the airport works really well - the stop on Blvd Rene Levesque is about 10 min. walk from hotel (that was with our luggage).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay with Baby: Great Service, Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: waterbug13
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely, long weekend in Montreal during which we stayed at the Hotel Omni. The location was the initial draw and we were not disappointed. Since we were traveling with our seven month old baby we wanted somewhere close to Mont Royal park, the art museum, Metra, St. Catherine's and downtown. The Omni delivered. The previous reviews I read about the staff were right on target. All staff members were welcoming and informative. Our hotel room had a great view of the park and though the room itself was a little worn it was very clean and had great natural light and windows. We were on the 19th floor and it was very quiet - this was a concern of mine since we were traveling with a baby and many of the other reviews I read about hotels closer to Old Montreal had issues with the noise. It was supposedly full up on one of the days we stayed and everything was peaceful. Montreal is a fabulous city and our stay was certainly enhanced by our hotel experience. I followed the advice of other TripAdvisor reviewers before me and enrolled in the Omni's Select Guest program (just took a minute online or you can sign-up at the desk) and enjoyed the perks like free Wi-Fi, free newspaper and free cold drinks in the morning. We plan to return to Montreal and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Aging luxury with essential goodness intact”
Reviews.Author: cantripper3000
Reviews.Content: You probably won't find a more comfortable hotel in Montreal, though its lusture as the former Four Seasons has faded somewhat. It has a nice pool and deck which, though surrounded by buildings, is large enough to receive sun at various points in the day. The service is efficient and pleasant. The rooms are large and sundrenched with deeply comfortable beds and wonderful pillows but are dated and ours retained a faint air of the heady days when smoking was permitted throughout the hotel. The mini bar fridge did not work. Apples at the front desk were a nice touch. Wifi, local calling and bottled water at extra expense were not.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful staff- very good 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom2592
Reviews.Content: The Omni is located on the edge of the downtown core but at the very center of chic, stylish Montreal. A five minute walk gets you to the central business district, McGill University, museums, galleries, night life and shopping. On a 1 to 10 scale, the location is a 10. The hotel is one of those modern hi-rises with almost no ground floor public spaces, so few that the main entrance is in the taxi drop area. The public areas, which are small and 1970s marble, gold and velvet are the hotel's weak point- but the hotel's staff and uber comfortable rooms compensate. The views of the park are stunning and rooms are big, plush and incredibly well maintained. The decor is a bit dated, but my room showed not one sign of knicks and dents or wear and tear. Someone is doing a better than outstanding job of maintenance. Omni's beds are second to none! Helpful, anxious to please staff, space and plush comfort, house-keeping that provides an example to the industry and a location second to none make the Omni a first choice. Previously I have stayed at the Queen Elizabeth and the Omni is far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTexas
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Omni Mont-Royal. We had a bright, spacious, lovely room in a great location, and the service was exceptional. Every staff member went out of his/her way to be courteous and helpful. One day I wanted a French specialty for lunch and asked the concierge for recommendations. He was relentless in searching online and by phone until he found it for me. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: RealDeal007
Reviews.Content: Their are possitives and negatives to this hotel. Unfortunatly I will not be returning to this hotel, and would not recommend it. We got this room at a nice price of 105$ CAN /night for 5 nights for the jazz Festival in montreal. The Location of the hotel was great, close to the mall, the metro, the jazz festival and a short metro or taxi to the waterfront. The hotel breakfast at the restaurent was awsome and the front desk staff GREAT! Now to the negative stuff :( Our first room 301 was good until the next day when we returned from dinner to find about 30 ants running around on the bathroom vanety. After comlpaining we were upgraded to a suite 3010. YAY! Well not quite, we open the bedroom doors to find a stain on the floor approx 2ft by 2ft in size, red in color, blood or red wine i'm guessing.... AND every morning starting at 730am, it sounded like they were adding a floor above us. Construction or revonations, whatever you want to call it was being done. We complained, but it continued the next morning aswell. This kinda ruined our trip. We like to sleep in and play at night, but it was hard to do this on this trip. Also the pool closes at 7pm, never got to try it :(

Reviews.Title: “hotel is ok, the spa is the worst ever”
Reviews.Author: muddy902
Reviews.Content: generally this hotal was alright. the location is good and close to crescent street and st. laurent. the rooms haven't been updated in awhile. our bathroom was disappointing. tub didn't drain quickly and the toilet ran. the big problem here was our spa experience. i was in montreal for a bachelorette and we booked appointments down at the spa. i cannot stress how awful this experience was. i'm not one to complain, but i thought someone was playing a joke on me. HORRIBLE. beyond words. DO NOT try to book services there. find a place on st. catherine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with caring staff”
Reviews.Author: ClaireVanB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent four nights at the Omni Mont-Royal following a cruise. We arrived at the hotel at 9 am assuming that we would have to check our bags and go explore the city while waiting for a room to come available. Amazingly we were able to get into a room immediately, even though this was on the weekend of the Grand Prix auto race. The room was very large and welcoming, and the air conditioning was quiet, something that often seems hard to find in hotels. The thing that impressed us the most about the Omni, however, was the responsiveness of the staff. We were on a non-smoking floor, and at first everything seemed OK. Late in the afternoon, however, when the air conditioning unit started, the air coming in smelled of stale tobacco smoke. Very unappealing! We mentioned it to the front desk and they promised to investigate and also offered to move us to another room if we preferred. We opted to stay in the same for that night and see what happened. By the next day the air coming in through the air conditioning was fine, but the best thing was that early that evening, the hotel sent us eight chocolate covered strawberries and a half-bottle of a very nice French white wine. There was also a note apologizing and explaining that they had found a patron who was smoking in their room on an adjoining floor, which was also supposed to be non-smoking and which was tied into the same air system as our floor. Their response made us feel that they had taken our complaint seriously and cared about our business. The hotel is ideally located right next to McGill University on Sherbrooke in an area that has many galleries, restaurants, boutiques, and museums. It is also very easy walking distance to the primary shopping and commercial street, Rue Ste.Catherine. It is a bit of a walk to Old Montreal, but not bad, and there is always the Metro. The concierge was very helpful in arranging a city tour for us and in recommending restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the hotel --especially the Priceline price I paid”
Reviews.Author: Writer46
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to have gotten a room at this hotel for $100.00 a night through Priceline. It couldn't be better located and, because I belong to Omni Select, I was able to check in at 10:30 in the morning and to have complementary coffee delivered to my room the next morning and free Internet access. I can't stress how valuable it is to sign up for this program and like Kimpton Hotels, there's no waiting around to accrue these perks. That said, the rooms could use an updating but they're perfectly clean and comfortable. The location is away from the scene in Old Montreal -- but it's perfect for exploring this fabulous city with its wonderful restaurants and gracious people.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, decent hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: evangelistmatt
Reviews.Content: The Omni was in a great location, perfect actually. The service was very good. The hotel was nice and decent, but not as new or clean as it should be for the price.

Reviews.Title: “i'd stay again....perhaps even longer!”
Reviews.Author: ifonlyihadwings
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated probably in the most convenient area in montreal. An entrance to the underground city is a block away, as are the two best streets for shopping, currency exchange, restaurants -- rue peel and rue st. catherine, among others. Take the 515 bus on Rue Peel to Old Montreal, but be mindful of the drop-off and pick-up times. We missed the last bus back to Rue Peel on our first night in Montreal, so the trek back to the hotel took us 40 minutes....in flip-flops. (Great intro to see the city, though!) Our room was on the 26th floor, so we had amazing views of the city and the river! Completely gorgeous view from the LARGE hotel window at night. The window was so large, it nearly took up a whole wall of the room. If you want an even better view of the city, just walk up the hill on Rue Peel to Mont Royal and take a 20 minute hike. You won't regret your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Hayes820
Reviews.Content: I was trying to think up a suprise valentines day getaway for my wife. We live in Maine, so I was looking throught the area...Had a little money to spend....so I was searching 4 and 5 star hotels. I looked at hotels in a dozen cities, from New York, to Montreal, and couldn't find a better looking deal than at the Omni. Got a "buy two get one free" offer, so three nights cost the same as two (less than $400 US). I would definatly say it's a solid 4 star hotel. Our room was a corner room, so we had a bit better view...room was large and bed was comfortable. Little details (robes in the closet and such) make you feel like your in a better hotel. No complaints at all.... (oh yeah, wifi 2 star...but who needs the computer?) The only downside? Montreal. We are experienced Paris vacationers, and were fine with the "frenchness" of Montreal...but for a Canadian city Montreal is dirty and unpleasant. In February, it's also a bit cold and windy...but we'll give it another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service at the Omni Mont-Royal”
Reviews.Author: SassySarahToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Mont-Royal in Montreal for 4 nights in April 2010. We selected this location for our meeting because of the wonderful service the staff gave us, and overall the experience was great. I arrived earlier than planned to the hotel (around 1:00 pm) and within 30 minutes, was given my room. A large, spacious room with a view of Mont-Royal. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. The only odd thing about the room was that the bathroom had a phone in it and when you got a wake up call, it rang in the bathroom. Strange, but effective in getting you up in the morning. The location of the hotel is superb. It is a few blocks north of St. Catherine's street, so it isn't that noisy and is right by McGill university. It is within easy walking distance of many restaurants, and the subway (Peel station is the closest). They had a fitness centre that is accessible 24 hours (with your hotel room key). I checked it out more than a few times and found that it had a lot of equipment choices. We stayed at the hotel for a business meeting and the staff there were beyond compare. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make sure that our meeting was a success. When I arrived, the staff had a plate of fruit and bottle water waiting in my room to thank us for having our meeting at their hotel. It was so thoughtful and really appreciated that. The staff at the front desk and concierge were equally as helpful and gave us excellent restaurant suggestions. A tip: sign up for the hotel's select guest program. It is free and will allow you to get free internet access in your room, a free newspaper each morning and a free beverage delivered to your room. We bought cereal from a grocery store and ordered milk each morning, and voila...had breakfast ready to go. The only complaint that I had (and it is minor) is that I felt that the staff were in our rooms quite a bit sometimes. I would leave for the day and sometimes return midday to drop off purchases. Obviously the room would have been cleaned by that point. Once I returned in the evening for the night, someone else would have been in the room again because I noticed that some lights were on and a robe placed on the bed. I mean, I really did appreciate the gesture. However, it made me think twice and realize that my belongings did need to be secured. Again though, this was a very minor complaint. I have been to Montreal several times and before this had always stayed elsewhere. However, the service and experience at the Omni were so great, that if I came back to Montreal, I would definately return to the Omni. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going on a trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay at the Omni Mt. Royal”
Reviews.Author: Onttravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I generally stay at the Omni Mt. Royal twice yearly, to visit family and friends in Montreal. We have always been well satisfied, and that is the case with our most recent stay at the end of March 2010. Having read one scathing review, below, I thought it best to offer a different perspective. Yes, the rooms are dated, in that the carpet is wearing and the TV, while still fairly modern, is not a brand new "flat screen". But the rooms, and carpet, are very clean, the amenities are all present, the service generally very good (and far better than some hotels that I stay in for business), and the food, either room service or down in the informal dining room, is of excellent quality and well served. While some new furnishings in the room would be nice, along with updated mechanics, by no means can it be said, from my perspective, that the hotel is dumpy or unpleasant. My wife and I are very picky and have walked out of some hotels over the years--that has never been a contemplated response at this Omni in Montreal. The beds are comfortable, the showers roomy, the soap of good quality and the towels plush--plus very pleasant staff, who seem to stay with this hotel as we recognize the same folks from stay to stay. Given the excellent location right in the heart of the city (no need to rent a car or to drive your own, just give it to the doorman and walk and Metro everywhere), plus reasonable room rates that are probably a reflection of the fact that room renovations are needed, we find the Omni hard to beat, and always enjoy our stay. Give it a try yourself and do look for the best rates on the various sites, including calling the hotel directly. The value is definitely there. Enjoy your stay in Montreal--a beautiful city that is interesting to explore--full of joie de vivre, and it starts with the friendly hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: E_Blackadder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni Mont-Royal the last weekend in March and had another great stay. The service was great, the rooms are neat and the location cannot be beat. You're pretty close to about everything and the subway is just a block away. I do recommend becomeing a member of the guest club since it does bring you some perks and it's free. I check in prior to our arrival and everything is ready for me when I get there. I just pick up the keys and off I go to our room. The decor is a bit dated, but not to the point where things are in disrepair. I have seen much worse for a lot more money. Give the Omni Mont-Royal a try and I'm sure you will go back. We first went after getting a great deal online at Hotwire 5 years ago and have been back ever since. We will not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “my son said it pefectly: "looks like we arrived at grandma's house"”
Reviews.Author: smbbeb
Reviews.Content: Ok - I got a REALLY cheap deal ... $129 a night for the 1st 2 nights and the 3rd night was free (it's the "linger longer" special they have on the omni website - works out to $85/night for 3 nights). Even so, I got there, stayed for a couple hours and couldn't bring myself to spend 3 nights there - even though it was such a good deal - you have to put a price to your enjoyment. If you are going to Montreal and don't plan on spending any time in your room - just a place to shut your eyes at the end of a busy day and not spend a lot of money then I would say go for it. It is a good location - right on Sherbrook and Peel - close enough to the shopping on St. Catherine (just a couple blocks - totally walkable), can walk to Mount Royal, the art museum and Cresent St (probably can't walk to Old Montreal though - that might be a bit far). But there are TONS of hotels in Montreal that are a great location!!!! Montreal is a very walkable city - everything is pretty close to each other - so if you stay at the Ritz, Sofitel, Hotel de la Montagne, Hyatt, Sheraton, Marriott, etc you will be in a great location - it's nothing that JUST the Omni has. I also have to say that the staff people WERE very nice as all the reviews said. They tried very hard to be helpful. The concierge was always smiling, they gave my kids "kids packs" on check in with little toys, offered to send milk and cookies up the room - and with signing up for the free loyalty program they send one hot and one cold drink for each guest to your room in morning and you get free wi-fi - but even so - THE ROOM!!!!! I just couldn't stay in there for 3 days. It was so dingy - low, low ceilings, cracked baseboard, dirty carpet, old furniture, old little tube tv. It wasn't dirty - like the sheets were clean the the bathroom was clean - but the furniture is all scuffed and cracked and wobbly, and just stains from wear and tear everywhere. Yuck. When I asked if there were any 'updated' rooms they said no, they were all like that and the hotel will be undergoing an renovation. They REALLY need one!!! The pool is closed till May but they did advertise a hot tub so I thought "ok, no pool, but my kids can go in the hot tub to splash around a bit at least". The hot tub was TINY and also gross. It was all cracked around it and attached to the empty pool that was all gungy and ugly to look at - I don't know who would sit in there. The gym is ok at least - but nothing great like the website makes it look. If you don't care about a pool or the quality of the hotel and you get a good deal then I can see how people like it and gave it great reviews - good location, friendly staff, cheap compared to other "4 star" hotels, good loyalty perks - but there is NO WAY it should be rated a 4 star hotel - I don't see how a hotel in that condition can be rated 4 stars??? Unless it's historic and gets extra points towards the rating system for that. I would compare the rooms to an older Best Western at best. For me I prefer to stay somewhere that's a bit more modern - that at least has furniture that's not all mashed up and clean carpet - and like I said, the location is nothing unique to just the Omni (nor is the view - lots of hotels face Mount Royal as long as you get a high floor) so I would give it a pass if I ever went back to Montreal. :-(

Reviews.Title: “Great place treat you life a star”
Reviews.Author: DennisD2
Reviews.Content: Great Place Treat you like a star... has alot of things to do right in the hotel fitness center, spa, massage, pool, bar, valet parking, and restaurants. Great food and right downtown only about a block or two from Saint Catherine Street. Can't wait to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff - I love the loyalty program!”
Reviews.Author: Born2Travel_Sarnia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is close to everything including the Metro. The rooms were a bit dated with low ceilings but very large with plenty of room. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They made sure all your needs were taken care of. Tip - sign up for the loyalty program and get free wi-fi and free beverages develivered to your room for breakfast! The service was outstanding and would definately stay here again on my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not A Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maturefamilytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for the February long week end. We have stayed at this hotel numerous times before and I am a Select Guest (Platinum level). We have opted for this hotel in the past because of its location and the hotel amenities. The Omni has historically had an outdoor heated pool with year round access. this can be important if you have children who need to have an activity to pursue (one that will burn up some energy). One of the nice things that the hotel does is provide complimentary cookies and milk for children upon check in. We arrived quite late on Friday night and were advised that they had run out of cookies. We agreed to cookies and milk for a subseuqent night of the stay. First thing Saturday morning, my daughter was up and dressed for the pool. Off we traipsed to the pool only to discover that the pool had been drained for the winter.
